56501.name: Klex-Klax: Das farbige Würfelspiel
56501.description: Each player has four meeples; they begin the game on the outer edge of the game board. Before them there is a train moving around the board. A color die determines a color on which a meeple or the train may be moved. If a train stops in front of a meeple, the meeple can board; later it can exit on the inside of the track. From there, the meeples have to move to a school. The game ends when six meeples are in the schools; the player with most meeples inside wins.

56502.name: Dungeon Maps Vol. 8
56502.description:
User summary:

A two-level dungeon map with 34 rooms one the first level and 32 rooms on the second level. Some rooms are irregularly shaped.

The first level is a mainly linear map with small side-circuits and some cross-linking.

The second level consists of three main interlinked cicuits of rooms with some diagonal corridors.

This royalty-free map set consists of a cover page, a map key page, two high-color textured maps (one with numbered rooms, one unnumbered) and an untextured 'printer-friendly' version of each map.

All maps are 300dpi resolution.

56504.name: Dungeon Maps Vol. 9
56504.description:
User summary:

A two level dungeon map.

The first level has 19 rooms laid out as branches from a central foyer. Other features include some semi-flooded areas and two staircases to subareas on the same level.

The second level has 11 rooms and is also laid out as branching corridors from a central point with a water feature and one staircase to a same-level subarea.

This royalty-free map set consists of a cover page, a map key page, two high-color textured maps (one with numbered rooms, one unnumbered) and an untextured 'printer-friendly' version of each map.

All maps are 300dpi resolution.

56505.name: Erasta Eestimaist
56505.description: This old Estonian game is a cross breed from several games like Payday, Go For Broke and Monopoly. In this game you will play for the year you have to live. Money is used to buy more or you can take years from your mom for example:D. By buying yourself properties you get years to your life and vice versa. It is basically just real estate game with some weird twists. Game is played by 2 dice and up to six players.

56506.name: Cavern Maps Vol. 1
56506.description:
User summary:

A single level cavern map with 14 chambers laid out in a simple circuit with some side branches. It features a small chasm and a sinkhole.

This royalty-free map set consists of a cover page, a map key page, two high-color textured maps (one with numbered rooms, one unnumbered) and an untextured 'printer-friendly' version of each map.

All maps are 300dpi resolution.

56508.name: Cavern Maps Vol. 2
56508.description:
User summary:

A single level cavern map with 11 chambers in a simple circuit with side branches. The map has two entry points on the same level and features a small stream and an open pit/well.

This royalty-free map set consists of a cover page, a map key page, two high-color textured maps (one with numbered rooms, one unnumbered) and an untextured 'printer-friendly' version of each map.

All maps are 300dpi resolution.

56509.name: Millennium: Spanning a thousand years from Fantasy to Future
56509.description:
From the introduction:

"Alone at night on a lonely road in the woods you are not the hunter but the hunted. You are prey for the beast breathing on your neck. There is no fleeing. The beast will follow. There is only fear!

This is what Millennium is all about. Man's fear, and constant struggle against the forces of darkness. Man's fight for survival in a hostile world.

Millennium should be looked at by the players and observers as a game that allows the player to represent man in a struggle against evil, the unimaginable, the immoral, vicious, wicked and sinful."

User summary:

A very basic role playing game. Attributes, Traits, Skills, Combat, and Magic are sparsely detailed in less than 32 pages. No sample adventure is provided.

56510.name: The Portal (Volume 1, Issue 1 - Sep 2006)
56510.description:
Table of contents:

THE SCRIVENER’S JOURNAL :
From the Editor
THE HARBINGER :
Welcome Letter & Things To Come by Gary Gygax
THE HAND OF HEKA :
Lunar Calendar- 13 Months of Lejendary Earth by Gary Gygax
THE EXTRAORDINARY LIFE :
Harvest Moon (Orc War Axe) by Spencer Wright
The Grim Thorn (Extraordinary Sword) by Spencer Wright
Night Helm by Jerry Leonard
THE MENAGERIE :
Ravenous Fleshmonger by Spencer Wright
Bonefiend by Spencer Wright
Death Hound, Guardian by Martin Siesto and
Jerry Leonard
AMONG THE POPULACE :
A Scurvy Crew- A pirate gang on the high seas! by Jon Creffield
THE JONGLEUR’S STAGE :
Soul-Searching (Fiction) by Jerry Leonard
RANDOM ENCOUNTERS :
Dancin’ in the Moonlight (Adventure Scenario) by Martin Siesto

56511.name: Into the Green: A Guide to Forests, Jungles, Woods, and Plains
56511.description:
From the back of the book:

Every campaign setting has a broad section of the map that is simply colored green. This is the wilderness, an unexplored and dangerous area ripe for adventure, but woefully undefined and undocumented. What does this green swath mean, and what can be found there?

Into the Green provides rich detail for four different types of green environments, describing the ecology, terrain, hazards, and resources of each. From tall alpine forests to dark foreboding woods, from lonely and sprawling plains to dense and sweltering jungles, no feature is left out.

Into the Green is designed as a guidebook for both players and GMs alike, providing the resources needed to flesh out a wilderness campaign, and the knowledge needed to survive in one. For the GM, Into the Green details the living creatures and the unique conditions that make up each of the four terrains. Trees, plants, animals, microorganisms, monsters, pitfalls, and climates are all included - the complete cycle of life is defined.

Along with each of the environments are a wide variety of skills, substances, spells, concoctions, devices, gear, and information invaluable for dealing with the specific hazards of the wilds. Every plant tells a story, every creature provides a clue to success, and every monster is a treasure in and of itself.

56512.name: The Portal (Volume 1, Issue 2 - Dec 2006)
56512.description:
Table of contents:

THE SCRIVENER’S JOURNAL :
From the Editor
THE MARKETPLACE :
An Up-to-Date Lejendary Adventure™ Product List
THE EXTRAORDINARY LIFE :
Aragund’s Serpent Sticks, Claws of the Eagle, Finnarol’s Flashy Stones, Sending Feather
by Jerry Leonard
Yeung’s Monocle
by Spencer Wright
Sreccum’s Wallflower Preserve, Egon’s Sticky-sweet Syrup, Seaside Bubbly
by Devon Whitmore
THE MENAGERIE :
Murderous Remainder, Bile Seeker, Mana Motes
by Spencer Wright
RANDOM ENCOUNTERS :
Scenarios From Chris Clark’s “SEAS OF HAZGAR” Campaign
by Christopher Clark
SCENARIO 1 : Hunter’s Camp
SCENARIO 2 : Trapper’s Camp
SCENARIO 3 : Logger’s Cam

56514.name: The Portal (Volume 1, Issue 3 - Jun 2007)
rpgissuearticle: Among The Populace : The Divinist Order
Random Encounters : Dread Mists Commentary - Making Mountains Out of Molehills
Random Encounters : The Dread Mists of Fairdale
The Scenic Route : 27 Ksarvinian Adventure Ideas
The Scenic Route : The Grand Duchy of KSARVINA
Tools Of The Trade : Mapping Sheets for the Lejend Master
56514.description:
Table of contents:

THE SCRIVENER'S JOURNAL :
From the Editor

THE HAND OF HEKA :
Statistical Guidelines for DEITIES and Other Powerful NETHERBEINGS by Gary Gygax

THE SCENIC ROUTE :
The Grand Duchy of KSARVINA
Ksarvinian Adventure Ideas by Jerry Leonard

AMONG THE POPULACE :
The Divinist Order by Jerry Leonard

THE MENAGERIE :
Drekavac, Vodnik, and Rusalka by Carrie Simmons
LIKHO: Goddess of Evil and Death by Jerry Leonard
Ilgash (NAC Race)
Rock Snake, Quake Lizard

THE EXTRAORDINARY LIFE :
More Arcane Treasures With Which to Reward or Plague Your Players...

RANDOM ENCOUNTERS :
The Dread Mists of Fairdale by Brant Bollman

Dread Mists Commentary - Making Mountains Out of Molehills

TOOLS OF THE TRADE :
Mapping Sheets for the Lejend Master by Jerry Leonard

rpgitemversion: First Quest- A Primeira Missão (Brazilian version)
Introduction to Advanced Dungeons & Dragons Game
56515.name: First Quest
rpgissuearticle: First Quest: A Aventura Começa Aqui
56515.description:
From the back cover

"The First Quest CD Audio Game is the fastest, easiest way you can play the AD&D game. Everything you need to get off to a great start is here!

The First Quest audio CD game contains:

The audio role-playing CD featuring over 60 minutes of digitally recorded sound-tracks, in its case
6 plastic player character miniatures with a hero card for each
Dungeon Master Screen and adventure book
Rulebook and 2 spell books
Full-color book of monsters and treasure
Full-color double-sided dungeon map
Player aid/character sheet card and town map card
Dramatic wall poster
Plus 7 adventure dice"




BGG Entry: Introduction to Advanced Dungeons & Dragons

56516.name: Empress Marava
56516.description:
User Summary:

Complete Detailed Deck Plans in 25mm Scale for the 200-ton Type A2 Far Trader merchant ship.

56517.name: To Challenge Tomorrow (4th Edition)
rpgissuearticle: Lies in the Book of Fate
56517.description:
Complete Basic Rules

From the back cover (spelling corrected):
"To Challenge Tomorrow is the future of roleplaying. It's the first and only roleplaying system to provide pure mechanics for use in any setting which are versatile, believable, consistent and simple.

Take your favorite roleplaying setting, rip out the second rate mechanics which so often plague otherwise great games, and plug in the elegant flexibility of To Challenge Tomorrow, a game system which emphasizes character development and roleplaying without sacrificing realism.

And once you've discovered the joy of roleplaying without arbitrary restrictions and mechanical glitches, you can move on to try out some of the dozens of To Challenge Tomorrow settings, such as London by Night for Victorian roleplaying, Challengers for superhero roleplaying, EsperAgents for psychic espionage and many, many others.

The new fourth edition To Challenge Tomorrow rules are completely revised and updated. The mechanics have been further streamlined, and for the first time To Challenge Tomorrow is completely compatible with Ysgarth, our groundbreaking fantasy system.

Open the door to a thousand brilliant adventures... play To Challenge Tomorrow."

56518.name: Endland
56518.description:
User summary:

The Endland rulebook describes the gritty post-apocalyptic world and its fantasy-inspired inhabitants. It presents character creation, combat, magic, and mutation rules and gives some GM advice on how to run Endland adventures.

This first edition was limited to a print run of 500 copies.

56519.name: No Man's Land: Planetary Atlas
rpg: Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century (5th & 6th Editions)
56519.description:
From the back of the book:

Adventure in one of the most dangerous regions of free space. No Man's Land is a place where only the bold, desperate, and dauntless travel. You always go to sleep at night, wondering if DEATH will come for you by morning. Battle the Cuontol, the Enidari version of the Ninja or uncover an assassination plot by the Black Monday Terrorist faction. In No Man's Land, Intrepids scramble to assist you while Yontacha seeks your "purification."

Over 100 detailed worlds, dozens of NPC groups, and 3 new character races. A warrior's destiny is ...

Somewhere out in No Man's Land

56520.name: Welcome to Rhum
56520.description:
User summary:

Welcome to Rhum is an introduction to the city of Rhum. It gives an overview of the history, government, citizens, and the money of Rhum. It also describes several locations like the city gates, a guard post, inns and taverns, and a moneychanger.

56521.name: Rhum After Dark
56521.description:
User summary:

Rhum After Dark describes several locations in the city of Rhum, including a poolhall, inns and taverns, a theatre, a casino, a cock fighting establishment, and a temple.

56522.name: Alien Wars (HD Character Pack)
56522.description:
From the Hero Games website:

All the package deals, equipment and vehicles from Alien Wars in Hero Designer format.

User Notes:

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

56523.name: Arcane Adversaries (HD Character Pack)
56523.description:
From the Hero Games website:

"All the characters and spells from Arcane Adversaries in Hero Designer format."

User Notes:

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

56524.name: Death Traps of the Aldar
56524.description:
User summary:

Death Traps of the Aldar is a LegendQuest adventure for characters with some experience. 375 or more character points are recommended.

In the adventure, the characters are sent into a cave complex of the aldar (LegendQuest's dark elves) who try to establish a base near the port city of Brinston.

56525.name: Blood in the Slave Pits
56525.description:
User summary:

Blood in the Slave Pits is a LegendQuest adventure for newer characters with 300-350 character points.

In the adventure, the characters are sent to defeat two goblin tribes who are taking slaves for the aldar (LegendQuest's dark elves). The goblin tribes seem to work together, but disagreement is growing between them.

56526.name: Asian Bestiary I (HD Character Pack)
56526.description:
From the Hero Games website:

All of the monsters, creatures, beings, and fantastic animals from Asian Bestiary, Vol I in Hero Designer format.

User Notes:

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

56527.name: The Player's Guide
56527.description:
User summary:

The Soothsayer Player's Guide contains character creation rules, mechanics for action resolution and combat, equipment ranging from fantastic items over contemporary to science-fiction devices, and rules for psionic powers.

56528.name: Asian Bestiary II (HD Character Pack)
56528.description:
From the Hero Games website:

All of the monsters, creatures, beings, and fantastic animals from Asian Bestiary, Vol II in Hero Designer format.

User Notes:

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

56529.name: Music from a Darkened Room
56529.description:
Scenario cover:
A Delta Green Investigation for 1 to 4 Agents

Wherein the Agents learn some threats are more tangible than others...

Publisher blurb:
An 34-page Delta Green scenario delving into the mysteries trapped within 1206 Spooner Avenue...

Dozens have died within the haunted walls of this mundane looking house.

What darkness is at work here, and what will it take to slake its thirst for innocent blood?

56530.name: Future/Perfect  (Parts 1 & 2)
56530.description:
From the module introduction:

Future/Perfect is a series of investigations linked together to form a single unbroken campaign. However, each investigation is self-contained and can be run as a one-off adventure.

The campaign is a great way to introduce new players to the world of Delta Green. They can be brought in completely ignorant of the conspiracy, or with some foreknowledge.
In any case, I hope you enjoy it.

56532.name: Lift
56532.description: This game is played on a 6x6 grid. One player puts 36 balls into the grid (3x12 of the same color). The pattern must be symmetric. Afterwards he/she covers the balls with 36 "lids". The other players now take turns lifting individual lids and checking the color. When a player thinks he or she knows the entire pattern, he or she makes a sketch on a piece of paper. After a number of rounds, the player with least errors wins.

56533.name: Revenge is a dish best served ...in Spaaace!
56533.description:
Scenario text:

If you’ve read ...in Spaaace! you know that it’s not exactly a prep intensive rules-fest. The bulk of this demo is an oddball clique united only by the desire to find a robot supervillain named NV. The characters are built with character rules. As the GM, you need to build challenges appropriate to the number of players with characters.

56534.name: Macht die Bäume wieder grün
56534.description: Players try to plant a forest from 36 tree cards (18 different trees). In order to plant a tree, the player must have a matching "planting card". Also, the other players can hand out obstruction cards which have to be covered with matching solution cards. The cards come with some information about the depletion of forests, a major topic in Germany in the 1980.

56535.name: The No Press RPG Anthology
rpghonor: 2004 Indie RPG Awards - Best Production - Runner Up
2004 Indie RPG Awards - Most Innovative Game - Runner Up
rpgissuearticle: Product Spotlight: No Press RPG Anthology
56535.description:
From the back of the book:

8 Original, Complete, Short-Form Roleplaying Games

Born of pixels and forum posts, tempered by the fires of playtesting, these unique games are presented here in print for the first time.

Snowball by Alexander Cherry
Discernment by Michael S. Miller
Pretender by Kirt Dankmyer
WTF by Daniel Solis
The Agency by Matt Machell
Pagoda by Jeffrey Schecter
Cell Gamma by Mike Holmes and
Over the Bar by Ben Lehman

with a foreword by Ron Edwards of Sorcerer

56536.name: Pirates Sworn to Captain Blood
56536.description:
Publisher's description:

The classic novel by Rafael Sabatini converted into an Adventure for your role-playing enjoyment. Live the classic! Make it your own! The greatest pirate in the Caribbean and perhaps the entire world wants you to join his crew and share in the fortunes of his incredible adventures!

Requires the Caribbean Campaign Setting sourcebook.

56537.name: Mahlzeit
56537.description: Simple roll and move game in which dogs try to get to bowls of dog food and bring them home. Afterwards they can turn them around. If the color of the bowl matches that of the dog that dog has won. If not, the dog has to start over.

56538.name: Forgotten Futures
56538.description:
Subtitle: The Scientific Romance Role Playing Game

From the back of the PDF book:

COMPLETE RULES FOR ADVENTURES IN VICTORIAN AND EDWARDIAN FANTASY AND SCIENCE FICTION

PROBABLY the first shareware tabletop RPG, Forgotten Futures has been published on disk and on line since 1993. What you see is what you get: everything that you need to play can be downloaded without charge, although you are asked to pay a registration fee if you find it useful. Registered users are sent the latest release on CD-ROM at least a month before files go on line, and with it additional material such as Victorian and Edwardian fiction, articles and illustrations, advertisements, etc. Currently more than a hundred megabytes of support material are on-line, including worldbooks, adventures, and the novels, articles, and stories on which they are based. The full Forgotten Futures CD-ROM adds more than 300 megabytes of additional background material.

Like all of the core Forgotten Futures RPG material, this PDF is a free download. It contains all of the rules that you’ll need to play the game, including many of the optional “extras” that have been added in various worldbooks and adventures. When you’ve taken a look check out one of the online adventures; Taking the Tunnel is a good start, since it doesn’t need additional background material. After that try one of the worldbooks and its associated adventures. If you enjoy the game, please register or buy the Forgotten Futures CD-ROM. 10% of the fee is donated to Cancer Research UK; so far over £1700 has been raised for charity from this and related projects.

.
.From the back of the printed book:

The Future's Not What It Used to Be...

A century ago, authors dreamed of futures that never came to pass. Forgotten Futures, The Scientific Romance Role Playing Game, explores these discarded possibilities; the futures that could never have been, and the pasts that might have led to them.

This book contains the Forgotten Futures rules, period historical background, surveys on dinosaurs, spiritualism, and weird science, an introductory adventure involving Queen Victoria and the Channel Tunnel, and a handy rules summary.,

Cover Illustration for the printed version: Martian War-Machine (after Kandinsky) by Ryan L. Johnson

56539.name: Onkel Doktor
56539.description: The players are doctors examining a patient. One illness is randomly chosen and hidden in a pouch. The players move "medical" items (stethoscope, thermometer etc.) around a board by rolling dice. When an item reaches a field with a matching symbol, the player can check a symptom from the pouch. In the course of the game, players gather more and more information until someone makes a correct guess about the disease.

56540.name: The Priest and the Hangman
56540.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to Corvus Lunaris' The Priest and the Hangman. This product is intended as a standalone roleplaying encounter that can, if provoked, turn into a rather atypical combat situation.

Suitable for characters of 3rd-5th level, this pack contains statistics and roleplaying notes for several NPCs arguing over the life of a man accused of a murder, in a quandary designed to test the morals of the adventuring party, not merely their combat prowess.

Also included are inch-scale printable battlemaps to make life a little easier and, in case things do turn nasty, the statistics of the lynch mob – including brand new rules of how to run one, and how to modify them to suit the situation better.

56541.description: Simple dice rolling game for the very young. Wooden horse figures are placed on the starting field of a circular track. Players then take turn rolling a color die. The horse of the color shown moves forward by one field. The first horse reaching the finish line (16 fields onwards) is the winner.
56541.name: Total verrücktes Pferderennen

56542.name: Werewolf Chronicles Volume 1
56542.description:
User summary:

Werewolf Chronicles Volume 1 bundles the adventures "Rite of Passage" and "Valkenberg Foundation" into a single volume.

56543.name: Fantasy Genre Compendium Volume I
56543.description:
Full title: Fantasy Genre Compendium, Volume I: Species, Professions, Gear, Magic and more

Publisher's description:

With a big long title like this, you will likely guess that this book is for fantasy roleplaying. Yes, it’s for “fantasy,” but we wanted “fantasy” to be more than crawling through corridors, hurling fireballs, crossing swords, and killing monsters. That is why our fantasy is a bit different.

In the Fantasy Genre Compendium, we talk about present fantasy as a genre in literature, comics, and film, but also rooted deeply in folklore and fairytales. Now, this genre is coming to the Cartoon Action Hour rules system, an Origins Award-nominated roleplaying engine known for quick and easy gameplay, using only a 12-sided die for all actions. The rules of Cartoon Action Hour have been specifically licensed from Spectrum Games for this project, and the highest amount of attention has been paid to a full compatibility of the compendium with the Cartoon Action Hour rulebook, and vice versa.

FGC Vol. I is lavishly illustrated by highly skilled fantasy artists.

FGC Vol. I is also the first roleplaying game book that uses photographs of painted miniatures as illustrations. The miniatures shown are high-quality resin figures by Fenryll.

56544.name: Mutants & Masterminds Pocket Player's Guide
56544.description:
Streamlined and reduced version of the Mutants and Masterminds core rules. Contains just the basic system information.

From the publisher:

Mutants & Masterminds is a complete roleplaying game with everything you need to start a campaign of rollicking superhero action. What if you just want to play the game, though? Do you really need all that GM-specific information? Now Mutants & Masterminds players have a choice. The Pocket Player's Guide contains all the rules you need to create characters and play Mutants & Masterminds. This handy rulebook gives you the core game system in a format that is affordable and easy to carry. Now it's even easier to see why Mutants & Masterminds is the World's Greatest Superhero RPG!

56545.name: Rauf & Runter
56545.description: This is essentially Snakes and Ladders, but the snakes (in this case: slides) and ladders are not printed on the game board but separate pieces which the players may place before their turn to influence the outcome of the game.

56546.name: Digital Hero (Issue 19 - Apr 2004)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56546.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- The Turakian Age, the new setting for Fantasy Hero., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- Pile on the layered defenses., by Steven S. Long
HERO UNIVERSE: Two new Sentinels, Iron Maiden and Lightwave, accompany their alien ally, Bronze Star., by Darren Watts
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: Jim Savage was a rough and tough frontiersman who became the ruler of five separate Indian nations., by Jason Walters
POWER LOCKED IN CRYSTAL FIRE: The legendary properties of gemstones and minerals have a great impact on Fantasy Hero campaigns., by Steven S. Long

RESOURCE ROAD

ANIME MARTIAL ARTS: Three anime-style martial artists from a variety of backgrounds are ready to enter your campaign., by Michael Surbrook
CUSTOMIZING THE CAMPAIGN: Having trouble adapting your game to fit the rules? Then just adapt the rules to fit your game., by James Jandebeur
PILOTING MANEUVERS: Hostshot space pilots can do more than just fly from Point A to Point B. Use these maneuvers to do it in style!, by Ben Seeman
VARUNA, LTD.: This organization for Champions can supply your superheroes with valuable intel on supervillain activity., by Allen Varney
GADGETEERS ON PARADE: Three characters show off different gear of their trades: Wolfsbane, the werewolf hunter; The Craftsman, fixer of of crime; Albert and his alchemical wares., by Dave Mattingly

56547.name: Digital Hero (Issue 20 - May 2004)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56547.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- get ready for feats of strength in The Ultimate Brick., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- Unclogging the Drain on modified Characteristics., by Steven S. Long
HERO UNIVERSE: The Sentinels saga continues with Archon, the immortal warrior, and Terry Quinn, the team's administrator., by Darren Watts
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: Alexander Keith McClurg, America's most infamous duelist, killed dozens of men, and then wrote depressing poetry about it., by Jason Walters
LEFTOVER HERO: Some Fantasy Hero monsters slipped between the pages of The Turakian Age, and landed here., by Steven S. Long

RESOURCE ROAD

THE GRAND MELEE: Medieval tournaments involved more than jousting knights. These Fantasy Hero rules and templates can add to your game., by Michael Surbrook
THE ENEMY OF MY ENEMY: Can three races that hate each other set aside their differences long enough to defend their planet in this Alien Wars adventure?, by Jason Walters

56548.name: So ein Affentheater
56548.description: Players roll and move their monkeys through the jungle. On some squares they can use a catapult and try to fling a monkey into a tree. The first player to get all three monkeys into the tree is the winner.

56549.name: Split 1000
56549.description: The game consists of number cards (1-10, 12, 15, 20, 25) and color cards. In a move, a player places two cards on an open stack. If he or she can place a number card higher than the previous one plus a color card of the same color on one stack, he or she gets to keep it (until it is taken away by another player).

56550.name: Digital Hero (Issue 21 - June 2004)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56550.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- get future and myth from Galactic Champions and Fantasy Hero Battlegrounds., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- get a grip on these expanded Climbing rules., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: John Gotti, the "Teflon Don," ran a criminal empire through a steel fist and charming manners., by Jason Walters
YOUR HOROSCOPE FOR: CAPRICORN: This Alien Wars adventure lands your Star Hero characters on any icy lake world full of Xenovores., by Allen Thomas

FANTASY FAIRWAY

LEFTOVER HERO: This secret map contains the location of a colony of brain-eating Migdalars that didn't fit into Fantasy Hero Battlegrounds., by Jason Walters
HERE THERE BE DRAGONS: Giant monsters and dragons from myth and legend await heroes foolhardy enough to seek him out., by Michael Surbrook

56551.name: Perfect 20 Roleplaying System (2006 Edition)
rpghonor: 2005 Indie RPG Awards - Best Free Game - Winner
56551.description:
User Summary:

Perfect20 is a streamlined version of the open gaming fantasy SRD from Wizards of the Coast. This version of the game uses only d20 rolls, has a non-class-based advancement system, and makes use of a few other simplifications.

56552.name: Fields of Blood: The Book of War
56552.description:
[From the back of the book]

Fields of Blood: the Book of War provides everything you need to rule a nation, raise an army, and assault your enemies on the battlefield. From realms to units to battle to magic, your character can now be a hero both in the dungeon and on the battlefield.

Fully compatible with version 3.5 of the d20 system, inside you will find:


How to define realms, and convert those from your campaign.



A primer on governing, from building and maintaining a small thorpe to taxing a vast nation.



Rules for mustering and training troops, from a unit of one hundred to an army of thousands!



A complete set of true mass combat mechanics, including siegecraft and fortifications.



A guide to incorporating core magic from other d20 books, as well as new battle and realm magic.



New prestige classes for every character type, designed for use in mass combat.



Appendices of spells and creature units, ready for play.


is the ultimate mass combat supplement for players and GMs alike. Start from scrach or bring in your onw setting, world and characters. Then, take your campaign to another level!

56553.name: Circle of Ice
56553.description:
From the back of the book:

In the battle between the Powers of Dark and the Powers of Light, the boreal domain of the Circle of Ice remains aloof. Snatched from your homeland by the Dark Lords, you must spy out the Circle of Ice for them - and return, if you can.

Circle of Ice is third in a series of Pocket Adventures designed for solitaire play with the Tunnels and Trolls game system. To enter the Circle of Ice you'll need a few six-sided dice, paper, pencil, and the Tunnels and Trolls rulebook.

56554.name: A Game of Inches
56554.description: The object it to get the cards to add up to 2 inches or come as close as possible without going over 2 inches.

56555.name: På poängjakt i Bibeln: Gamla Testamentet
56555.description: A swedish quiz game about the bible (the old testament). The players score points by collecting cards in different "families" and by answering questions about the bible.

56556.name: GURPS Traveller: Humaniti
56556.description:
From the Back of the Book:

In the far future, mankind has scattered to many worlds and divided into many races... and some are very alien, despite their Human ancestry. GURPS Traveller: Humaniti describes 16 Human-descended races from the far reaches of the Imperium and beyond, including the technologically advanced Darrians (with their sun-smashing Star Trigger), the carnivorous Dynchia, the dour warrior Azhanti, and the agressive Itharians.

56557.name: Digital Hero (Issue 22 - Aug 2004)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56557.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- The Mystic World and Fantasy Hero Grimoire., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- encrypted radio transmissions., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: Mungo Park, explorer of the dark continent of Africa, set the stage for other explorers to follow., by Jason Walters
LEFTOVER HERO: Take a tour of the forgotten realms of The Mystic World, by Dean Shomshak

RESOURCE ROAD

CHALLENGES FOR BRICKS: Many bricks are known for nigh-indestructiblity, but there are other ways to give them a good contest., by David Rakonitz
RIGELLIAN CODE-TALKERS: These aliens have developed astounding abilities with their unusual sets of vocal cords., by Bob Greenwade
THE PRINCIPALITY OF SEALAND: Off the coast of England sits a small platform that has declared its independence, and become the world's smallest country., by Ray Lowery

CHARACTER CORNER

A PAIR OF JACKS: These two serial killers terrorized Victorian England, and were never captured., by Michael Surbrook
WHISPER AND DECEIVER: This vengeful ghost and master assassin have destinies intertwined with each other as well as with VIPER., by W. Jason Allen

56558.name: Digital Hero (Issue 23 - Sep 2004)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56558.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- mow'em down with Dark Champions., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- look your best with these expanded Comeliness rules., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: Rector Harold Davidson was known as "the prostitute's padre" in early 20th Century London., by Jason Walters

SPORTS ARENA

BASEBALL HERO: Batter up! Baseball season is over, but these rules for playing baseball in HERO will tide you over 'til next year., by Dave Mattingly
GRIDIRON: Hut one! Hut two! This ex-football playing villain still uses his football martial arts style to commit crimes., by Ross Watson

RESOURCE ROAD

MORE FU SCHTICKS: These extreme martial arts maneuvers and stunts can increase excitement and flavor during your games., by Michael Surbrook
KNACKS: What can you do with a single point? There are dozens of cheap talents and perks to spice up that character sheet., by Dave Mattingly
M'LARRNE: This Star Hero race of dog-evolved aliens has a history of intrigue and guerilla warfare., by Michael Surbrook

CHARACTER CORNER

TEMPORAL CHAMPIONS: There are time travelers that wreak havoc along the timestream, and there are these who prevent such tampering., by James Jandebeur

56559.name: Digital Hero (Issue 24 - Oct 2004)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56559.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- Arcane Adversaries and DEMON: Servants of Darkness., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- many options for movement powers., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: Calamity Jane worked, played, and fought like a man, but had a woman's heart under that rough exterior., by Jason Walters

ADVENTURE AVENUE

AND THERE WAS BLOOD EVERYWHERE!: A giant blur on the satellite photo of Africa leads to unthinkable horrors for your Champions team., by Scott Bennie

RESOURCE ROAD

BULLY FU: Hold onto your lunch money, and guard your head against noogies, as characters learn "Bully Fu.", by W. Ross Watson

CHARACTER CORNER

THE CHOIR: This octave of outlaws orchestrates its crimes perfectly, under the leadership of their maestro, Virtuoso., by Denver Mason

56560.name: Digital Hero (Issue 25 - Nov 2004)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56560.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- Vibora Bay and The Ultimate Mystic., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- Let's get Physical Limitations., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec was the quintessential bohemian artist, as well as a fixture of the Parisian underworld., by Jason Walters

ADVENTURE AVENUE

THE HELMET OF DR. DESTROYER: Far in the future, an ancient artifact has been discovered which can prove that superhumans once walked the Earth., by Bob Greenwade

RESOURCE ROAD

LOOK! UP IN THE SKY!: Flying contraptions from history and folklore permeate the heavens, from balloons to fighters to rockets., by Michael Surbrook

56561.name: Heretics & Outsiders
56561.description:
Back Cover:

Threats to Crown and Soul
The Known Worlds are rife with those who refuse to follow the social order. Whether practicing their rebellion in private or fomenting public revolt, these malcontents threaten the powers-that-be. Heretics refuse to follow the Church's doctrines of proper faith, and so risk their own souls and those of others through their example. Psychics plot to overthrow mundane humanity -- or worse, attempt to force psychic awakening on others through the mysterious Sathra Effect.

It is not only humanity's soul that is so threatened, however, for its very right to rule itself is challenged by the potential power of the alien Vau Hegemony. The incursions of the metamorphic Symbiots threaten to warp peoples' own bodies. What's more, barbaric human star-nations lust after the riches of the Known Worlds -- or wish to forcibly convert their citizens to false faiths. Amidst these dangers, is it any wonder the stars darken before such sin.

Heretics & Outsiders is the second volume in the Secret Societies series. Sir Chamon Mazarin, the Emperor's spymaster, presents new dossiers on heretical cults, underground psychic covens and foreign intelligence agencies -- including Vau infiltrators and Symbiot insurgents.

Also included are d20 System rules for new occult powers, tools of the spy trade, and two new prestige classes: The Dervish and the Master Spy. These rules require the use of the Dungeons & Dragons Players Handbook, Third Edition, published by Wizards of the Coast.

56562.name: Into the Dark
56562.description:
Back Cover:

Every Known Worlds peasant and priest knows to fear the unseen powers of the Dark, the nemesis of the Empyrean Light. So why do so many adventurers seek out the unknown, unexplored regions of space, risking their lives and souls for material gain? Are they insane? Stupid? Or are they fearless foes of ignorance and superstition? Perhaps all of these things at once.

Into the Dark provides five meaty dramas and numerous short adventures that pit characters against the unknown, testing their mettle in a crucible of terror or triumph - only they can choose which it will be. This book features:


"Thorn Manor": An addled old noble refuses to abandon his ancestral mansion before the threat of terraforming cataclysms. Can the rumors of an ancient treasure be true? And if so, can anyone find it before the planet swallows the place?
"Dark Liner": A damaged luxury liner floats helplessly past the jumpgate into the Dark Between the Stars, taking with it the only known copy of a holy scripture. Can anyone rescue the relic before the ship succumbs to forces beyond mortal ken?
"Love's Labors": A love-smitten noble seeks aid in winning the hand of a beautiful lady, but he must first achieve three nigh-impossible tasks.
"The Ancestor's Tomb": The sins of House Li Halan's past awaken to haunt the present. Only the courageous - or foolhardy - can imprison the terror and escape the tomb alive.


These tales and more are found inside.

56563.name: The Otherwhere Quest
56563.description:
From the back of the book:

The Otherwhere Quest is a solitaire adventure that allows you to play your favorite Green Lantern: Hal Jordan, Guy Gardner, or John Stewart. You must find the clues that uncover the secret hiding place of the Harmony Beacon, but more importantly, you must prove yourself worthy of wielding its great power. Above all, you must hurry: only hours remain before the forces of darkness overwhelm the Otherwhere forever!

56564.name: Legions of the Empire
56564.description:
Back Cover:

Lock and Load

In the far-future Fading Suns universe, might equals power. No one rules for long without militry might to back him up - even the Patriarch has a fleet of battle cruisers! This book brings out the Known Worlds' most dangerous people and places with a bang, allowing gamemasters to put players in the middle of the bloodiest conflicts against the most feared warriors - including the Symbiot-fighting Stigmata Garrison! The armies and navies of the Known Worlds are examined in detail, from life on an Imperial Cruiser to recruiting a mercenary unit. New weaponry and war tech provide numerous excuses to blow thing up.

The fourth in a series of Fading Suns factions books. Other books in this series include: "Lords of the Known Worlds," "Priests of the Celestial Sun" and "Merchants of the Jumpweb."

56565.name: Digital Hero (Issue 27 - Feb 2005)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56565.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- Explore the swords and sorcery world of The Valdorian Age., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- Lighten up with an Alter Mass power., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: The Ballarat Bandit hid in some of the harshest terrain in Americas, and stole from the Hero Games staff!., by Jason Walters
LEFTOVER HERO: The Soul-Sucking Sword got cut from The Valdorian Age, so it killed the magazine editor and snuck into this issue., by Allen Thomas

RESOURCE ROAD

MINIATURE HERO: Learn how to buy or build terrain for your miniatures, and apply special effects such as flight and damage., by Bill Keyes
THE NIGHTWATCH: The popular "monster hero" genre puts normally evil paranormal creatures in the role of protectors., by Matthew Gaul
SURPRISE!: Does your game night feel like the same-old-same-old., by Parker Emerson

ADVENTURE AVENUE

TSUNAMI: This Champions adventure sets your heroes against a group of villains planning to destroy the city in a gigantic wave., by Michael Satran

BONUS FEATURE

CHAMPIONS CROSSWORD by Dave Mattingly.

56566.name: Digital Hero (Issue 28 - Mar 2005)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56566.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- there's Villainy Amok in your city; are you the heroes to stop it?., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- whittle away your pain with expanded Damage Reduction rules., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: The most famous and beloved luchadore (masked wrestler) of all time, El Santo became a hero and symbol of the sport., by Jason Walters
LEFTOVER HERO: Hudson City has had its share of the supersoldier programs, with more failures than successes., by Steven S. Long

RESOURCE ROAD

ASSASSIN'S ART: Hired killers sometimes have a particular means to their bloody ends, by using this martial art., by W. Ross Watson
BLOOD BROTHERS: Vampires and other bloodsuckers from around the world come in more varieties than you might expect., by Michael Surbrook
MINIATURE HERO: Miniature gaming can quickly drain the wallet. These "terrains on a budget" tips can stretch your buying power., by William Keyes
THE WHOLE PACKAGE: Add some of your favorite movie hero types to your [Dark] Champions campaign with these package deals., by D.T. Butchino

BONUS FEATURE

CHAMPIONS CROSSWORD by Dave Mattingly.

56567.name: Digital Hero (Issue 29 - Apr 2005)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56567.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- Lose yourself in some of Hero's Hidden Lands., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- Physician, heal thyself with REC-based Regeneration., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: "Liver-eating" Johnson was one of the most fearsome mountain men ever to inhabit the Old West., by Jason Walters
LEFTOVER HERO: Captain Claw and his pirate ship, the Doom Rose, escaped from the upcoming book, Hidden Lands., by Darren Watts
MINIATURE HERO: Getting miniatures to look good close up is an art, but getting them to look good over the internet is a science., by William Keyes

ADVENTURE AVENUE

PROJECT: PREDATOR: Amnesiac mutants try to escape their captors and remain free in this mutants-on-the run convention game., by Ed Hastings

BONUS FEATURE

CHAMPIONS CROSSWORD by Dave Mattingly.

56568.name: Digital Hero (Issue 30 - May 2005)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56568.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- Dark Champions: The Animated Series livens up your game., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- Back to the basics with power building blocks., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: Pytheas might have discovered the New World centuries before Columbus and the Vikings., by Jason Walters
LEFTOVER HERO: Scott Bennie's excellent Villainy Amok books was a bit too long to fit within its actual pages., by Scott Bennie's

RESOURCE ROAD

HOME AWAY FROM HOME: For a new superhero, home is where you hang the cape. Here are some samples for your characters to start with., by Charles Braden
VARIANT HUMAN GENOTYPES: In space, no one can hear you gene-splice. These altered human races for Star Hero can apply to multiple genres., by Bob Greenwade
THE WHOLE PACKAGE: Add some of your favorite occult hero types to your [Dark] Champions campaign with these package deals., by D.T. Butchino
SUMMONED MONKEY WARRIORS: Ninja's Hero's John Wa, the Monkey King, can summon these monkey warriors to his add., by Michael Surbrook

BONUS FEATURE

CHAMPIONS CROSSWORD by Dave Mattingly.

56569.name: The Seventh Seal
56569.description:
User summary:

The Seventh Seal rulebook contains all the rules and background information required to play:

- setting information
- character creation rules
- game mechanics and combat rules
- GM advice
- a bestiary of demons.

56570.name: Tulmadron: Das Buch des Lebens
56570.description:
User Summary:
Das Buch des Lebens (The Book of Life) details the Tulmadron character creation and advancement.

The pages are photocopied typewriter pages with some headings printed on a dot matrix printer. Many of the illustrations are used illegally without the permission of the respective artists.

56571.name: Werewolf Chronicles Volume 2
56571.description:
User summary:

Werewolf Chronicles Volume 2 bundles the adventures "Ways of the Wolf" and "Monkeywrench! Pentex" into a single volume.

56572.name: Rage Across the World Volume 3
56572.description:
User summary:

Rage Across the World Volume 3 bundles the adventures "Rage Across New York" and "Rage Across the Amazon" into a single volume.

From the back cover:

Garou Across the World

The War of the Apocalypse rages across the globe as the Wyrm seeks to destroy Gaia. The Garou preserve the legends of an idyllic world that existed before the corruption brought about by humanity and the Wyrm. They battle those evils to the death to bring about a new Golden Age, but can Gaia still be saved?

Victory is Yours

Now you can fight the War of the Apocalypse from its earliest days. Rage across the World Volume 3 is a compilation of two classic Werewolf sourcebooks: Rage Across New York and Rage Across the Amazon.

Rage Across the World Volume 3 features:

-Rage Across New York and Rage Across the Amazon, two of the earliest Werewolf supplements ever released
-The war against the Wyrm frought from the den of human civilization to the last hope of Gaia Herself
-The Garou's final defense in the War of the Apocalypse

56573.name: Rage Across The World Volume 1
56573.description:
User summary:

Rage Across The World Volume 1 bundles the supplements "Caerns: Places of Power" and "Rage Across Russia" into a single volume.

From the back cover:

Garou Across the World

The War of the Apocalypse rages across the globe as the Wyrm seeks to destroy Gaia. The Garou preserve the legends of an idyllic world that existed before the corruption brought about by humanity and the Wyrm. They battle those evils to the death to bring about a new Golden Age, but can Gaia still be saved?

Unite!

Now you can fight the War of the Apocalypse from its earliest days. Rage Across the World Volume 1 is a compilation of two classic Werewolf sourcebooks: Caerns: Places of Power and Rage Across Russia.

Rage Across the World Volume 1 Features:
Caerns: Places of Power and Rage Across Russia, two of the earliest Werewolf supplements ever released.
Important game information on creating Garou caerns, with fully developed tribal caerns worldwide.
Your chance to fight the War of the Apocalypse all over again. How often do you get a second chance in life?

56576.description: There are 13 letter dice and three number dice. All dice are rolled at once. The numbers on the dice determine the goal of the round: The letter dice have values, and the players have to find a word made of the available letters with the overall value determined by the dice.
56576.name: Sofort

56577.name: The Unspeakable Oath (Issue 13 - 1995)
rpgissuearticle: Cthulhu Lives - Live Action Lovecraftian Roleplaying
From Beyond - The Gentle Art of Slaughtering Investigators
Scream & Scream Again - Letters From Lunatics
A Tale of Terror - The Urge to Purge
The Eye of Light and Darkness
Windigo Psychosis - a look at a chilling form of madness
56577.description:
subtitled For Call of Cthulhu.

Cover by Daniel Gelon

Volume and Issue designation dropped with this issue, released in 1995.

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

56578.name: 1991 Trading Cards
56578.description:
User Summary:
The 1991 set of AD&D trading cards contains 750 numbered cards. Each card has an image of a character, magic item or monster from a D&D world and the corresponding AD&D statistics on the back.

The cards were sold in randomized foil packs of 16 cards, with "Set One" of the 1991 series drawing on cards from the first block of 360 cards and "Set Two" drawing on the second 360 cards. A further 30 cards were only available as special promotions.

At the end of the year, a "Premier Edition Factory Set" was released which was a box containing all 750 cards in the set. These cards had a silver border to distinguish them from the gold-bordered cards in the foil packs.

56579.name: 1992 Trading Cards
56579.description:
User Summary:
The 1992 set of AD&D trading cards contains 750 numbered cards. Each card has an image of a character, magic item or monster from a D&D world and the corresponding AD&D statistics on the back.

The cards were sold in randomized foil packs of 16 cards, with "Set One" of the 1992 series drawing on cards from the first block of 360 cards and "Set Two" drawing on the second 360 cards. A further 30 cards were only available as special promotions.

At the end of the year, a "Factory Set" was released which was a box containing all 750 cards in the set. These cards had a silver border to distinguish them from the gold-bordered cards in the foil packs.

56580.name: 1993 Trading Cards
56580.description:
User Summary:
The 1993 set of AD&D trading cards contains 495 numbered cards, plus a second set of 60 "Ruby" cards. Each card has an image of a character, magic item or monster from a D&D world and the corresponding AD&D statistics on the back. The 1993 series includes a number of special mini-series with themes such as "Shopping at Auroras", "Ships" or "Arms of Greyhawk".

The cards were sold in randomized packs of 16 cards, release in three sets during the year. There were a total of 555 cards in the 1993 series. Unlike the previous two years, the 1993 "Factory Set" of silver-bordered cards contains only the 495 regular cards, and not the 60 special and promotional cards.

56581.description: 3-D Chess is played on a 4x4x4 grid. The published board is a two dimensional representation of a three dimensional board. Special rules govern the movement of the pieces in the third dimension. White begins on the upper most level, while Black begins at the bottom. The object is the same as traditional chess - checkmate the opposing king.
56581.name: 3 Dimensional Chess

56582.name: Dragon's Rest
56582.description:
From the back of the book:

Your heroes find themselves on a demi-planar island in the Ethereal void, where a mysterious god enlists their help in his scheme to stop Erestem (Takhisis). The heroes must journey through space and time to recover the powerful cindergems and forge a weapon to destroy Erestem. If your heroes fail, Erestem's evil minions will invade Taladas and destroy the Othlorx (Uninvolved) dragons, which is just the start of her plans for Taladas!

Your PCs must venture into eras and places hitherto unknown to them. The cindergems are strewn throughout the multiverse; ancient dragon burial grounds, magical ice palaces, crypts of restless dead, and much more await the heroes. And just who is that mysterious god who asks so much of them?

This AD&D® game adventure, set in the vast world of the DRAGONLANCE® saga, is the conclusion to an epic adventure that began with Dragon Dawn and continued with Dragon Knight. On the previously unknown continent of Taladas, the heroes must strive to thwart the extraplanar invasion plans of Erestem, Queen of Evil, also known as Takhisis. Failure means doom for all of Krynn!

You need the Time of the Dragon boxed set in order to play this adventure. You need not have played either of the previous modules in this series; alternate beginnings are provided for players who have not done so.

56583.name: Sport Quiz
56583.description: Simple roll and move game with one twist: on some place of the board the players have to answer trivia questions about the Olympics or world championships. 500 questions in Hungarian are included.

56584.name: Handbuch für Spielleiter: Korrigierte Seiten
56584.description:
User summary:

Handbuch für Spielleiter - Korrigierte Seiten (translated: Handbook for Game Masters - Corrected Pages) is a 48-page errata for the first printing of the German Dungeon Masters Guide. It contains corrected reprints of pages 241 to 288.

56585.name: Dystopia
56585.description:
From the back of the book:

The World's an imperfect Place

Lock up one group of supervillains, and another batch springs up, begging to be thrown in prison. The latest volley from the underworld is a group of hired guns called the Coalition.

They're making life difficult: razing city blocks, hitting the local banks, tearing down the local jail, taking hostages in the city's central Trade Tower, and the list goes on.

The world's far from perfect, but somewhere, you have to draw the line.

Dystopia is a Champions adventure designed for four to eight heroes from 250 to 300 points.

Dystopia contains:
- A complete description and background of the Coalition, a group of mercenary villains who eagerly mix it up with your heroes... for the right price.
- Several short adventures that gently integrate the Coalition into a pre-existing campaign.
- "Dystopia," a fully-detailed adventure foreshadowed by the short adventures.
- Adventure seeds for continued Coalition operations after the full-length scenarios in this volume are completed.
- Conversion notes to make this adventure suitable for play with Dark Champions.

56586.name: Champions Universe 4th Edition
56586.description:
The ultimate heroic campaign setting is finally here— all in one book! Everything you need to base your heroes in the world of Dr. Destroyer, Mechanon, and the Champions is presented here. Years in the making, the Champions Universe was created by pulling together all of the characters, organizations, adventures, places, and events presented in past Champions products and coupling it with pages and pages of new material.

For you who have been fans of Champions for a long time, find out new information about your favorite characters and events, plus discover the wealth of new characters and material. Find out what Dr. Destroyer thinks of various villains, who's the controlling force behind Raven, and why Firewing and Plasmoid hate each other. Learn the organizational structure of VIPER, and of a secret location in Australia that contains limitless power for those who can wield it. The Champions Universe is bursting at the seams with information to provide you with the greatest role playing setting for your heroes that you could ever wish for—whether you're just starting out or have been playing for years.

Included in Champions Universe:
- A complete listing of all organizations, both criminal and otherwise.
- A glossary containing entries for every character, group, location, and device in the Champions Universe.
- A timeline including important battles, origins, and events contained both in various character backgrounds as well as in various adventure supplements. Also includes tips on including your characters in the timeline, making them truly a part of the Champions Universe.
- An atlas with all the information you need to set adventures anywhere in the world, including the local superpowered individuals, active organizations, and special locations for each continent—even Antarctica.
- New, never before seen characters and organizations as well as the updating of older groups such as Freedom Squad and Deathstroke to the 4th Edition rules (as well as the 1990's).
- Discussions on technology, superhumans and society, magic, paranormal athletics, supervillain relations with one another (i.e., who likes who and who hates who), and much, much more!

56587.name: The War of the Worlds
rpgissuearticle: Nuts & Bolts of the Action! System
56587.description:
From the Back of the Book:

"It was seen early in the morning, rushing over Winchester eastward, a line of flame high in the atmosphere. Hundreds must have seen it, and taken it for an ordinary falling star."

With the Action! Classics: The War of the Wolrds source book and either the Action! System or the d20 System core rules you have all of the tools you need to relive the classic story of the Martian invasion of Earth!

Now you can read the novel and run exciting role-playing adventures in 1900s Edwardian England as humans in the ultimate struggle for survival against the horrific martian invaders!

The invasion has begun. Can you survive?

56588.name: Gamemaster's Screen for Champions (3rd Edition)
56588.description:
User summary:

The Gamemaster's Screen is a 3-panel screen with the adventure "The Island of Dr Destroyer" stapled into the screen itself.

56589.name: Champions Presents #2
56589.description:
From the back of the book:

You are our only hope.

A mad computer, a murderer killing supers, and a whole organization of slimy snake-guys—run of the mill fare for a group of heroes? Hardly.

Champions Presents #2 is a brand new compilation of adventures, characters, and organizations for Champions. MAVRIC is an adventure that pits the heroes against a crazed computer out to wreck their lives. Murder in Stronghold is a super-powered mystery that the characters must solve before time runs out... for them. Coil describes in detail the organization of King Cobra, the most notorious of master villains.

Champions Presents #2 includes not just adventures, but dozens of new characters, groups, vehicles, robots, bases—come on, do you need any more? Well, if you do, there are also extensive guidelines and tips for running a murder mystery (with super heroes in mind), suggestions for further adventures, and plenty of interesting robot-building techniques.

Champions Presents #2 will enhance any campaign, and will provide hours of fun and challenge for any player, any power level. What are you waiting for? You know it's going to be good...

56590.name: Dungeon (Issue 95 - Nov 2002) / Polyhedron (Issue 154)
56590.description:
Volume XVI Number 5

Cover by Richard Whitters
Polyhedron cover by Stephan Martiniere

The two issues are printed back-to-back; one side has a Dungeon front cover, and if you turn the magazine upside-down, you see a Polyhedron front cover.

Issue quote:
"Death
Grinn'd horrible a ghastly smile, to hear
His famine should be fill'd."
--John Milton, Paradise Lost, Book ii, Line 845

The tables of contents are detailed in the Article list below.

56591.name: Wrath of the Seven Horsemen
56591.description:
Arthur Wooms has always had a deep craving for power. While exploring a long forgotten Inca temple he found a strange, dark, worm-scepter. As he picked it up he was suddenly surrounded by thin piping voices asking him what he wanted. Driven by his unsatiable longing, Arthur screamed his answer: POWER! Power to frighten and horrify, power to torment and crush. As the scepter seethed and coiled, the transformation began. For Arthur, the time of retribution had begun!

Thus was born Fear, first of the Horsemen. With the power of the scepter, Arthur could call forth an individual's dominant trait and amplify it to overwhelming dimensions. By concentrating on the darker side of human nature he created the Horsemen: Death, Destruction, War, Famine, Terror, and Plague!

WRATH OF THE SEVEN HORSEMEN is a multi-part adventure scenario for CHAMPIONS. It can be used as the basis for a campaign or it can be inserted into an already existing campaign. Each scenario leads logically into the next, providing a smooth flow of play.

Have your superheroes become so powerful that they take on any villain as just a part of the day's work? This vicious batch of high-powered bad guys won't be taken so lightly! The Seven Horsemen will re-introduce desperation and fear into your adventures.

56592.name: Stäbe, Ringe, Dschinnenlampen
56592.description:
(user summary)
This sourcebook centers about magic item and potions.
Their creation, strengths and weaknesses and the analysis of magic items is described in detail.
A lot of famous and infamous magic items are given as a examples.

56593.name: Őseink nyomában
56593.description:
In this game players start with a secret mission to conquer certain areas (counties of the medieval Hungary). When a territory is attacked, a type of question is randomly chosen. A third player describes a phrase verbal, pantomimic or by drawing, or asks a trivia question about history, art or science. The first of the two opponents to answer wins the battle. The first player who conquers all the areas on his/her mission card wins the game.

Expansion: Őseink nyomában pótkérdések 10 éves kortól

56594.name: Twilight: 2000: Classic Reprint Series
56594.description:
This is a reprint of the following Twilight: 2000 books in one volume:

- Twilight: 2000
- The Free City of Krakow
- Pirates of the Vistula
- The Ruins of Warsaw
- The Black Madonna

rpgitemversion: Nedime, de dochter van de Kalief
56595.name: Nedime - die Tochter des Kalifen
56595.description:
Translated from the back:
The glamourously beautiful daughter of the caliph has been abducted. Sultan Hasrabal is keeping her imprisoned in his palace. By coincidence you overhear a conversation about the difficulties which get in the way of freeing her. So you decide to help Nedime out of her predicament. Only later you find out that no one returned alive who set out prior to you ...

56596.name: Bortom: Lögnens slöja
56596.description:
A Swedish role-playing game, roughly translated to Beyond: the veil of the lie.

From the back of the book:
Bortom: Lögnens slöja är ett modernt skräckrollspel. I Bortom konfronteras spelets karaktärer med det vi andra inte ser eller vill låtsas om. Det oförklarliga som finns där i kanten av synfältet, bortom slöjan av lögner. Den som en gång har sett en annan verklighet blir sig aldrig lik. Sakta skiljs denne från vardagen och blir främling för det vanliga samhället.

Hur präglas din karaktär av insikten att det finns en annan värld bakom lögnens slöja? Hur långt vågar du gå i utforskandet av den världen? Det är upp till dig att bestämma!

Temat i Bortom är utforskandet av det okända. Genom att utforska den dolda världen mysterier vinner karaktärerna nya insikter och kunskaper - om världen och om sig själva. Det finns nämligen en bakomliggande berättelse till allt, en som bara väntar på att bli utforskad.

Är du redo att möte en annan verklighet?

Roughly translated to:
Bortom: Lögnens slöja is a modern horror role-playing game. In Bortom you are confronted with the things that we want to make-believe or don't see; the inexplicable that exists in border of our field of vision, beyond the fog of lies. Those who once have seen a different reality will not be the same person again. Slowly they are parted from the everyday and become an alien to the society.

How are you characters formed by the knowledge that there is another world beyond the veil of the lie? How long do you dare to go in the exploration of that world? It's up to you to decide!

The theme in Bortom is the exploration of the unknown. By exploring the hidden world, mysteries gain the characters new insights and knowledge - about the world and about themselves. Because there is a underlying story for everything, one that are waiting to be explored.

Are you ready for another encounter with a different reality?

56597.name: To Serve and Protect
56597.description:
From the back of the book:

Who can you trust?

For years, they have traveled the globe, battling villains, helping victims of natural disasters, and making the world safe for mankind. They are role models for the children, symbols of hope for the oppressed, and champions for justice They have earned the world's faith and trust, for they are superheroes, and they have always been there to serve and protect.

But what would happen If these powerful heroes suddenly turned evil? What if they chose to use their mighty abilities to condemn the world rather than protect it? Would anyone be safe from their wrath?

To Serve and Protect is a multi-part adventure scenario for Champions that pits your heroes against the might Protectors, a team of renegade crimefighters who threaten the entire planet. Included are complete descriptions of the experienced superhero team along with maps and statistics for their floating Citadel headquarters and their flying transport, the Skycruiser. Also included are detailed notes for their Super Agency, Protectors, Inc. And to top it off, we've included a powerful new villainess, rising out of ancient legends to execute her deadly judgment upon mankind.

The world is trembling with dread. People are fleeing from the streets as their former defenders stalk the city with a thirst for blood. Terrified voices cry out everywhere for someone to rescue them.

Who will protect us from the Protectors?

56598.name: Champions Presents
56598.description:
WE'RE LOOKING FOR A FEW GOOD SUPERHEROES.

Champions Presents is an anthology of three of the best adventures that Hero Games has to offer. Each action-packed adventure is completely separate and can be played as such, or a Gamemaster can follow the guidelines given to intertwine the three adventures into a comic book-style campaign. Each adventure is fully detailed with NPCs (over thirty new characters!), layouts, bases, and everything else a GM needs to run the scenario.

ADVENTURE NUMBER ONE: Can you stop the evil villain group Spectrum, as they attempt to take Washington D.C. by storm in order to pass a paranormal restriction act? A pulse-pounding, no-holds-barred climactic battle on capitol hill finishes off this incredible adventure written by Scott Sigler.

ADVENTURE NUMBER TWO: Its called No News of a Thaw, and this adventure involving ice demons, other dimensions, and a quest to save the world from domination by creatures of terrible cold is as off-beat as they get — but a challenge for any heroes worthy the name. Written by Phil Masters.

ADVENTURE NUMBER THREE: The final installment in this incredible trilogy is Menace Out of Time, written by Dean and Dana Edgell. As it's name would imply, this adventure involves time travel, both with the villain Tempus ripping things from various times to menace the characters, and the heroes chasing their foe through time. Nazis, robots, war gods, futuristic lawmen, ghosts and dinosaurs are the heroes' adversaries in this mind-boggling battle through time. Can your heroes keep from becoming marooned in the distant past? And if so, can they face the final, startling conclusion of the Menace Out of Time?

56599.name: Classic Organizations
56599.description:
From the back of the book:

PRIMUS NEW YORK HEADQUARTERS:

"Listen Silver Avenger, we have a riot down here - there must be at least 40 or 50 to a side."
"Stay calm, son. Have you notified the local superheroes?"
"Sir, these ARE the superheroes."
On April 5, more than 30 paranormals, led by the Supreme Soviets, attacked the Sanctuary, which was defended by more than 4 dozen paranormals. When the dust clearerd, the building was destroyed and all these organizations had been changed forever.

A supplement for Champions which updates four Champions organization books, Neutral Ground, Red Doom, PRIMUS and DEMON, and C.L.O.W.N.: Classic Organizations is a must for anyone running a superhero campaign set in the Champions Universe or anywhere else. New Champions players can now use these often hard to find organizations to add to their campaign. Owners of the original products will want to see the updated characters and the changes as well as find out how Glasnost affected Red Doom, where the new Sanctuary has been located, the true nature of DEMON, and much, MUCH more!

Classic Organizations includes:

- Over sixty characters, many of them never seen before and all converted to 4th Edition Champions rules for the first time
- Over thirty-five new scenarios involving the organizations. Enough scenarios to keep the average gaming group playing for well over a year!
- New group write-ups reorganizing the organizations, giving more detail of their pasts and what has transpired since their original publication.
- New bases with full layouts and complete descriptions
- The largest paranormal battle in the history of the Champions Universe - and guidelines on how to involve the player characters.

56600.name: Creature Catalog
56600.description:
From the back of the book:

Lurking behind these covers are over 150 of the most ferocious, wondrous, and challenging creatures of the D&D game. This new Creature Catalog revises and expands on the older product of a similar name, which it replaces. The perfect companion to the D&D Rules Cyclopedia, the Creature Catalog updates old monster descriptions, provides information compatible with the new Rules Cyclopedia, developes monster background information, and includes new creatures and old fiends from the very best D&D adventure modules. With the Creature Catalog, a DUNGEON MASTER can find the right monster to challenge any adventuring party, from 1st level on up.

- Covers and illustrates over 150 creatures not included in the Rules Cyclopedia!
- Contains and updated D&D creature index.
- Features new wildernes encounter tables.

Suitable for all levels of play

56601.name: Babewatch
56601.description:
Game introduction:

This is the sun, sex, sea and sand role-playing game of beach babes and lifesaving hunks. Keep your tongue in your cheek, a
tin in your hand and escape for a while to sunnier climes.

User summary:

A small satirical rpg themed on a popular beach-oriented television show. Each character has three Abilities: Body, Brains, and Sex Appeal. Each character also has 10 skills they may select.

56602.description:
The age of industrialization has come to the United States. Iron roads cover the once virgin landscape and investors pocket generous returns. However, something is stirring in the graveyards of Pennsylvania and Michigan. The recently dead are rising from the grave and attacking cities in increasing numbers, which makes the end of year returns increasingly paltry and the competition stiffer. The future of the human race seems to be in question, but a more immediate concern is occupying train company owners: how to maintain profitability in the midst of a Zombie Apocalypse?

This expansion for Age of Steam features 2 maps, each designed to accommodate a different scale. the Western Pennsylvania map supports 4-5 players, while the Michigan map is tailored especially for 3. The expansions additionally come packaged with a dedicated action/income/shares track, and 30 plastic zombies due to the generosity of Twilight Creations, Inc., who have allowed the reuse of their excellent plastic zombie bits. The expansion is intended for experienced Age of Steam players and features very little randomness after the initial board set-up.
56602.name: Age of Steam Expansion: The Zombie Apocalypse

56603.name: Lord Erbian's Stellar Bestiary
56603.description:
From the publisher:

The 23rd edition of the original Lord Erbian's, verified by Imperial exchequer -- accept no imitation. Surveying the Known Worlds and beyond since 4732. The foremost guide to dangerous and intriguing zoology, xenology and cryptoxenology, including beasts and aliens real, imagined and devilish. Don't be taken in by false editions! Let the original and verified Lord Erbian's mentor your purchase or safari!

Lord Erbian's Stellar Bestiary is a collection of creatures for Fading Suns and Fading Suns: d20 space-fantasy roleplaying. It presents dual stats for each creature -- both HDI's Victory Point System and Wizards of the Coast's d20 System. It includes alien beasts from all over the Known Worlds, the barbarian worlds and even Vau and Symbiot space.

56604.description:
SGK Veto 2ed is the second edition of this title and the first Polish CCG game set in the historical times of the 17th century. Basically this game is a duel, but the rules introduce also other ways to win - dimplomacy, intrigues and using military force. At once up to 5 sides - factions - can play.

The plot of the game is settled in the historical reality of the 17th century, Poland's heyday, the times of the gentry, covering Europe and Asia. The designers also referred to the Polish historical and contemporary prose, like Henryk Sienkiewicz (Nobel prize winner) and Jacek Komuda.

In 2009 Kuźnia Gier became the publisher of the game. This new publisher reprinted the basic decks designed by Wydawnictwo Imperium and added a new starter deck of Osmanowie (the Ottoman Empire - this faction was introduced by the Casus Belli expansion in boosters). Kuźnia Gier released their first own expansion in 2009 and further two in 2010. The line is constantly expanded with new products.

Veto CCG has now seasons of the game (each season starts with releasing a set of sarter decks and contains next three expansions), which is connected with rotation of legal cards in the organized tournament system. So far Veto has had three full seasons: basic season (Veto 2ed, Charakternicy, Casus Belli, Ogniem i Mieczem), Warchoły i Pijanice (eng. "Dipsos and Troublemakers", inlcuding Ogniem i Mieczem (partly), Do szabel, Rębajłowie, Krwi) and Szpiedzy i Dyplomaci ("Spies and Dimplomats", including W niewoli, Spiskowcy, Królobójstwo). The current season is called Czarty i Upiory ("Devils and Ghosts") and will introduce a supernatural element to the otherwise historical game.

In July 2014 Historical Games Factory became the new publisher of the game.

In Veto 2ed. there are 5 factions - decks (in the first edition there were only 4):

- Awanturnicy
- Dworscy
- Radziwiłłowie
- Wiśniowieccy
- Osmanowie (added by the Casus Belli expansion and fully present in the game until Królobójstwo, now illegal in most organized tournaments)

SGK Veto 2ed. has also several expansions with brand new cards:

Basic season:
- Veto 2ed.
- Charakternicy
- Casus Belli
- Ogniem i Mieczem

Warchoły i Pijanice:
- Do szabel
- Rębajłowie
- Krwi

Szpiedzy i Dyplomaci:
- W niewoli
- Spiskowcy
- Królobójstwo

Czarty i Upiory:
- Cmentarzysko
- Danse Macabre
- Malleus Maleficarum

Potop:
- Initium Calamitatis Regni
56604.name: Veto! Szlachecka Gra Karciana 2 edycja (2ed)

56605.name: Pikk-pakk
56605.description: This game is played on a 9x9 grid. There are 49 balls, 24 and 24 in the color in the players and one special ball placed in the inner 7x7 grid (it can be random, or the players put their balls step by step, or they choose a starting position together). In a step a player can push all the balls in a row or a column to one direction if he/she controls more than half of those balls. The game end if the special ball has 4 neighbors of the same color (that is the winning color).

56606.name: Digital Hero (Issue 31 - July 2005)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56606.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- gear up with The Hero System Equipment Guide., by Steven S. Long
HEROGLYPHS: See how Steve Long himself answers rules questions. This issue -- paying for all of those free powers., by Steven S. Long
YOU GOTTA HAVE CHARACTER: Flavius Belisarius was perhaps the world's greatest military tactician. And loyal to the end., by Jason Walters

MYTHICAL MAYHEM

MYTHIC HERO: The legends of Hercules vary by the teller, so are presented here at two power levels., by John R. Ivicek Jr.

CHAMPIONS CORNER

EUROGUARD: Someone has to stop Eurostar! And this team assembled for the task has a mighty good chance., by Bill Keyes and Denver Mason

56607.name: Digital Hero (Issue 32 - Aug 2005)
rpgissuearticle: WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…
56607.description:
Adapted from the Table of Contents...

HERO HIGHWAY

WHEN LAST WE LEFT OUR HEROES…: Keep up with the news from Hero Games. This issue -- Powers, Predators, Pugilists, Pulps, and Pubescents., by Steven S. Long
