56876.name: The Four Magics
56876.description:
Subtitle: A Sorcerous M&M Superlink Supplement

From the Introduction:

The M&M rulebook describes only one version of magic: Sorcery. This is an exceptionally potent power, both flexible and useful. It reflects most comic-book magic relatively well.

However, most magic systems portrayed in fantasy novels and in folklore (or modern religions) are quite different from comic-book magic. They are not always fast, not always reliable, and typically have a lot more "flavor" to them. Sorcery might be a great power, but it’s a little bland. What we hoped to do here is make magic a little more... well, a little more magical and mystical.

To this end, we’ve created four new systems of magic suitable for use in M&M games which concentrate more on fantasy settings, or for when you just want a different take on a sorcerous character. These magic systems can be used on their own, or as inspiration for how to alter your own game’s Sorcery power.

There are also a few new extras and flaws which were created in the process of making these magic powers; we think of them as "tools to make the tools." Perhaps you might find a use for these on other powers as well.

rpg: Human Interface for Fantasy Role Playing
56878.name: The Human Interface for Fantasy Role Playing (Platinum Edition)
56878.description:
A self-published set of Fantasy role-playing rules by IGS Games.

From the Introduction:

"This game was designed for both the first time player and the veteran gamemaster who is looking for a reason to resurrect that old beloved campaign. The rules are not tied to any one particular fantasy gaming world. Instead they are applicable to any of the myriad worolds found in popular fantasy literature, films, and television series."

56879.description:
Sabuesito y el grito de Independencia is a children's roll & move game with questions and answers on the first attempt of independence from Spain in Quito (Ecuador), on August 10th 1809.

The game was created by Luis Arregui and published by the Ecuadorian Ministry of Culture. Its goal is to promote reading habits among children (the game is accompanied by 40 brief tales) and to help in learning the history of Ecuador.
56879.name: Sabuesito y el grito de Independencia

boardgamehonor: 2010 Deutscher Lernspielpreis "9 years and up" Nominee
56880.description:
Seven splendid towns “wait” to be looted by you. On each turn, you decide what target you’re aiming at. However, all of you too often get in each other’s way.
The longer an outlaw stays in a town, the more stolen goods he can take with him to the next town and turn into money there. But he who takes his time could fall into the sheriff’s hands.
You get rich not only if you make a fat haul, but turn it into cold cash. The one who leaves the seventh town with the most money is the bandit who can’t be beaten, and wins the game.
56880.name: El Paso

56881.name: Lincard
56881.description:
Game system where 48 cards (from Ace to Queen in all four sets) build a 7x7 board centered in one single card summing up all Kings. Cards can be connected to the existing board following their order within the set or sideways by cards with the matching symbol, each way scoring differently.

Several game variants are offered (from 1 to 8 players), as well as adaptations of other known games to the system.

boardgamecompilation: De Weerwolven Van Wakkerdam: Het Pact
The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: The Pact
56885.description:
Game description from the publisher:

After the terrible tragedy of the so-called "New Moon", the village became a desert of ruins. Many years later, some brave outsiders rebuilt the village stone by stone, with the treasures amassed from their latest adventures. They then launched a clarion call to encourage all homeless adventurers to come live in this new ideal village.

From all corners of the country, volunteers flocked to live in brand new houses, farms and shops. Some even camped on the village square, waiting for houses to become available. Thus, the school is once again filled with the laughter of children and the tavern is filled with playful echoes of conversations, punctuated by the clink of filled glasses. However, there remain claims that werewolves exist among the new community!

Welcome to the Village! As in the original game of The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow, players assume characters in the charming village, with some players secretly being werewolves who tear apart one of the human citizens each night. However, in Village, players will also assume a trade/profession.

Note that The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: Village is both a standalone game and an expansion for the original game, although the card sizes in Village differ from those in the original game.
56885.name: The Werewolves of Miller's Hollow: The Village

boardgamehonor: 2014 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Nominee
56886.description:
By Fire and Sword – a historical wargame is the name of a battle system developed by the Wargamer Company. We wanted to create a realistic, playable and dynamic wargame which recreates the 17th century wars fought by the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth against Turkey, Muscovy, Sweden, Crimean Khanate and Cossacks.

The period between 1640 and 1676, on which the game focuses, is a time of almost constant warfare waged by the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth on all fronts, in many cases with several enemies at the same time. Supplements planned for the game will be dedicated to specific wars and campaigns in which the Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth took part during the entire 17th century.

"By Fire and Sword" is a comprehensive system including game rules, historical background for the forces of all the combatants, battle group creation rules and scenarios, but most of all a huge number of wargaming figures representing all the military formations of the warring parties.
56886.name: By Fire and Sword

56887.description: Hungarian expansion to the party game Activity junior where players have to describe words verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. This expansion contains more than 600 new phrases.
56887.name: Activity Junior pótkérdések

56888.description: Another version of the well known party game Activity where you have to describe expressions verbal, pantomimic or by drawing. In this version every expression is an action. It contains 438 cards with 1314 expressions.
56888.name: Activity Action

56889.name: Kajko i Kokosz: Wielki Wyścig
56889.description:
Tematem gry jest wyścig dookoła grodu Mirmiłowo, a celem jest zdobycie jak największej liczby złotych dukatów. Nie będzie to jednak zwykły wyścig – zwycięzcą może bowiem zostać gracz, który nie dotarł do mety jako pierwszy! Innym elementem wyróżniającym grę jest rozwój przez gracza postaci, którą gra. Dzięki temu w trakcie rozgrywki możliwości danej postaci będą rosły.

This game is a race around the city of Mirmiłowo, but the goal of the game isn't necessarily finishing first, but rather getting the largest number of ducats. Therefore, the winner might not be the person who first reached the finish line! Players must develop their character during the course of the game to have greater capabilities during the race.

56890.description:
From Warfroggames.com:

Steam Barons is the first expansion for Mayfair's Steam.

Two maps are included in the game, one covering eastern USA, along with parts of Canada, and the other covering northern England.

The maps are suitable for five and six players if you use the base or standard rules from Steam.

An additional set of rules are included which allow you to play the game in a different manner. The Steam Barons rules introduce a stock-market system to the game. Now you can buy and sell shares in the railway companies. The biggest advantage of these rules is that the maps become playable by between two and six players.

The game also includes 144 wooden train pieces which must be used with the Steam Barons version but can also be used with the base and standard games. An additional 38 tiles have also been included to avoid shortages with the larger maps.

Similar to

Railways of England and Wales (for the stock market part)
56890.name: Steam Barons

56891.name: Night Below
56891.description:
From the back of the box:

A missing mage...
A ruthless band of kidnappers...
A sinister conspiracy...

Night Below, the first epic campaign adventure for the AD&D game, is designed to take the player characters from 1st level to 10th level and beyond. The PCs start as beginning adventurers on a routine courier mission who soon become drawn into combating a sinister plot that menaces the pleasant land of Haranshire.

By the end of Book I, The Evils of Haranshire, the player characters should have worked their way up to 5th level. Book II, Perils of the Underdark, shifts the scene underground as the characters search the seemingly endless realm of the underdark to discover the fate of the kidnappers' victims. By the time they reach the dark cavern of The Sunless Sea in Book III, they should each be 10th level or above, ready at last to confront the ultimate evil behind the far-reaching conspiracy.

Inside this box are:


Three 64-page books comprising a single grand-scale adventure, which can be placed in any AD&D campaign world.
16 Player Handout sheets featuring are, maps, charts, and letters.
8 two-sided DUNGEON MASTER Reference Cards providing cutouts, monster rosters, and two new evil deities.
An eight-page booklet of new MONSTROUS COMPENDIUM entries detailing three new races and two new monsters.
6 full-colour poster maps detailing all the important locations in the entire campaign setting.

56893.name: Headquarters & Hideouts
56893.description:
From the Introduction:

Headquarters. Hideouts. Lairs. Labs. Be they caves, mansions, space stations, or extra dimensional hidey holes, bases of operation have long been a staple of superhero stories. The best such places were as much characters as the heroes and villains of the tale, taking on a personality, style, and feel of their own. A hideout spoke volumes about its inhabitants, from the trophies kept there to the location of the hideout, important facets of the owner could be discerned. All in all, headquarters are much more than places to simply hang your cape and mask.

This book contains additional rules for creating headquarters, new rules for trainable skills and feats, and the details on a number of headquarters including history, abilities, inhabitants and maps. Also included is an adventure to demonstrate how to use one of these locations in your campaign.

56894.name: Headquarters & Hideouts 2
56894.description:
From the introduction:

Headquarters. Hideouts. Lairs. Labs. Be they caves, mansions, space stations, or extra dimensional hidey holes, bases of operation have long been a staple of super-hero stories. The best such places were as much characters as the heroes and villains of the tale, taking on a personality, style, and feel of their own. A hideout spoke volumes about its inhabitants; from the trophies kept there to the location of the hideout, important facets of the owner could be discerned. All in all, headquarters are much more than places to simply hang your cape and mask.

This book contains additional rules for new headquarters features, building superpowers into headquarters, and a number of example headquarters complete with their inhabitants. While it serves as a companion piece to Headquarters and Hideouts 1 the first book is not strictly required, though very useful. Headquarters and Hideouts 1 is not required to use this book, but there are many references to headquarters features and rules with in it.

56895.name: Power Corrupts
56895.description: User Summary: A Mutants and Masterminds Superlink product. This volume includes fifty new powers for M&M with discussion of associated power stunts, extras and the like.

56896.name: Power Corrupts 2
56896.description: User Summary: A Mutants and Masterminds Superlink product. This volume includes fifty new powers for M&M with discussion of associated power stunts, extras and the like for those powers. Also includes a section with new general general use extras, flaws, and weaknesses. Thirteen example characters are also presented.

56897.description:
A Scenario Book for Better Dead Than Zed!

SEND IN THE ARMY

We already had the best zombie game in our Origins Award winning first ATZ and now we have the best campaign system.

Z-Day took mankind by surprise and for a long time there's been no sign of resistance. But now rumors of safe zones are spreading through the land. They say the military has taken back large areas and local radio broadcasts are urging survivors to head to these safe havens.

But not everyone wants to go.

Groups of survivors have their own "safe" areas under their control. They are self-sufficient and doing okay. Not great, but okay. And they like their new found freedom and look forward to finding like-minded recruits. They're making the best of a bad situation.

But they're not alone. Gangs of lawless people have their own areas under control. These gangs patrol the highways looking for loot, prey, and in some cases new recruits. They like things just the way they are.

In Haven you have three options:


MILITARY - We allow you to command military units by introducing you to better weapons, new equipment, and a list of missions for you to play. It's time to kill some Zombies and pacify the area.
SURVIVOR - We provide you with Nowhere Nevada, a self-sufficient community that you can explore, trade, and perhaps recruit from it.
GANGER - We give you a ready made gang, place to live, and opportunities to grow your power.


It's all up to you.

All Things Zombie: Haven is a supplement. You must have ATZ: Better Dead Than Zed to play.
56897.name: All Things Zombie: Haven

56898.name: Relics & Rituals: Olympus
56898.description:
From the back cover:

Capture the Golden Fleece. Sail between Scylla and Charybdis. Pit your strength against the Gorgons, or attempt to accomplish the Twelve Labors. Command the spells of Circe and Medea. Ascend to the lofty halls of Olympus, or trek deep into the lightless caverns of Hades. Carry the gods’ favor — and beware their curses. Play a beloved child of Zeus, a sacred huntress of Artemis, or a warrior born of the dragon’s tooth. Tread the hills and ply the seas of a Greece that never was, or infuse your own campaign world with the wonder and majesty of classical myth.

All these options and more await you within the pages of Relics & Rituals: Olympus, a genre sourcebook that melds the classical heroism of Greek myth with the familiar d20 System ruleset. Suitable for any d20 campaign.

REQUIRES THE USE OF THE DUNGEONS & DRAGONS® PLAYER’S HANDBOOK, PUBLISHED BY WIZARDS OF THE COAST®. THIS PRODUCT UTILIZES UPDATED MATERIAL FROM THE V.3.5 REVISION.

Sword and Sorcery™ books are published under the Open Game License and are 100% compatible with v.3.5 rules.

56899.name: The Complete Guide to Rakshasas
56899.description:
Publisher Blurb:

At the dawn of creation, the rakshasa openly ruled all the world. Greatest among them was one called Ravana, acknowledged by even the most egotistical rakshasa as their rightful king. He had been born into the world many times, growing in power with each incarnation, until finally he brought all mortal races under the power of rakshasa.

However, Ravana's rule was destined to end. He overlooked one particular mortal hero, who was reincarnated time and again, thwarting Ravana's schemes whenever he appeared. Finally, as Ravana was closing his grasp around the last few creatures who resisted his rule, this hero was born into the world one more time.

Under the name Ramachandra, this hero battled Ravana's allies and armies, overcoming them every time with his lethal archery and iron courage. What followed were battles that lasted years and filled the oceans with blood, but finally Ramachandra's bowmanship overcame Ravana's might, and the rakshasa lord was slain.

Rakshasas hold that when they die, they are judged by their great king Ravana. Those who possessed great power and cunning are reborn as even mightier individuals, and the greatest rakshasa will someday return as Ravana. In fact, before his last battle Ravana foretold that he would be reborn one more time into the world, prepared to enslave it forever with his wickedness. But he also warned that his ancient nemesis would return, wielding a flaming sword and mounted on a white horse as noble as himself.

The Complete Guide to Rakshasas takes you into this world of ancient myth and unbridled ambition in a journey where each adventure is merely one episode in an eons-spanning quest. Become a rakshasa undertaking grand schemes in the hopes of returning as Ravana. Hunt Ramachandra in whatever form he may take. Or simply take the reins of power and rule for a century or two . . .

Features:

True revelations of the history, lore, and goals of the malevolent rakshasa.
Rules for playing rakshasa and yaksha (half-rakshasa) as player characters.
Rules and background for those who would defeat the rakshasa: the new yogi base class, the Hunter of the Firstborn prestige class, and organizations such as the Order of the Asthra and The Shattered Gate.
Extensive DM guidelines on how to play a rakhasa to maximum effect. How do reincarnation, immortality, infinite patience, and absolute deceit manifest in game terms?
New equipment, feats, magic items, and monsters to round out the rakshasa pantheon.
And much more, all of it compatible with the 3.5 revision!

56900.name: Book One: Awakenings
56900.description:
From the back of the book:

Awaken...

To An Epic Science Fiction Role Playing Game

The dawn of a new age is upon us...

Although we have been asleep in our dream crystals for almost 50,000 years, we have seen the comings and goings of many ages. We were part of an age of super-science and super technology. As members we could create stars and manufacture whole planets from the fabric of the universe itself. In our arrogance we thought we could do anything until one day we woke up a sleeping horde of demons. These demons, the Qualarians, were more powerful Tuluantos Empire, came to an abrupt halt. While most perished, a few found ways to survive. It took over 50,000 years to rid the universe of these Qualarians.

But now is the dawn of a new age. A new set of people have woken from the ashes of the old. Although bold, arrogant, and powerful in their own right, they do not realize the delicate thread from which they hang. But these new people have an edge. They are underneath our watchful eyes as we chronicle this new age, these new people. We are the Xodar Xro Dinn. We watch this new age, an age of awakenings, unfold before our eves.

Welcome to the universe of The Xro Dinn Chronicles. This is a complete science fiction role playing game which has the mysterious Xodar Xro Dinn as a central theme. The Xro Dinn Chronicles is a versatile game designed to spark the imagination. The intricate details allows for you to choose from many different kinds of campaigns. The choice is yours. As a player, you play one of the up and coming races within the galaxy. Each race is richly detailed to bring out the flavor of the race- even the technology is tailored to fit the physiology and culture of that race. I hope you enjoy playing!

THIS BOOK INCLUDES:
- The beginnings of an ancient saga
- The mystery of the Xro Dinn and their chronicle of this new age
- 5 player character races and 2 non player characer races
- Specialized alien technology
- And much more!

56901.name: Viking Age
56901.description:
Publisher Blurb:

For the Glory of Odin...

They were bloodthirsty. They were savage. And they dominated Northern Europe in the Ninth and 10th Centuries. they were the vikings, and they had just one goal: to die heroically so that they could enter Valhalla, and serve Odin in the last battle, Ragnarok.

Avalnche Press brings you the most complete RPG book on Norse-Mythology ever. Learn about Norse culture, Viking warfare, and the special magic known as sejdr. Take the roles of a crazed berzerker, a wise rune-caster, or one of the gods. Viking age offers eight new character classes, a host of new Skills and Feats, and two new magic systems. Take your d20 campaign to a whole new level of adventure, playing a Norse god trying to stave off Ragnarok. Packed with historical information and new rules, this is the definitive RPG book on Vikings and their gods - how they lived, how they fought, and, most importantly, how they died.

56902.name: Star Riders
56902.description:
From the back of the book:

A delirious role-playing game in the best (and funniest) space opera tradition!

When the Dadourunrun Conundrum Empire's bureaucrats slightly "misplace" Earth - the coolest planet in the Known Universe - during o galactic reorganisation, you start looking for it, of course! Live the great adventure, with the not-so clever Leroy and the beautiful Tabada. Explore the Known (and Unknown) Universe while visiting strange places and meeting even stranger beings!

STAR RIDERS is a wacky science-fiction role-playing game. It comes complete with rules, equipment and character stats. Star Riders is also compatible with the Teenagers From Outer Space role-playing game from R. Talsorian Games Inc.

56903.name: Fantasy Earth Basic Rules
rpgissuearticle: The Oft Bitter Pill: Capsule Reviews
56903.description:
From the back of the book:

"Sir Jeteki quickened his pace and moved his hand closer to the hilt of his sword as he scanned the shadows for signs of movement. He had left his friends back at the bar and his armor back at the palace. Now he was seriously regretting the entire outing. Suddenly, two men stepped out of the alley just ahead of him. As they drew short swords from under their dark cloaks, Jeteki glanced over his shoulder to see a third man stepping out behind him, a glint of metal reflecting moonlight under his cloak as well. He quickly considered his options. Three on one was a dangerous fight, even for the greatest swordsman in Trent, especially without armor, and there was no knowing how many more were lurking in the shadows. As the two in front closed on him, spreading to encircle him, Jeteki drew his sword and slipped it past one man's feeble parry and into his gut, dropping him instantly. He nimbly dodged the attack of the second thug and turned to face both remaining assailants while slowly backing in the direction of the city gates', and safety..."

Welcome to the world of Fantasy Earth, a world of gritty, low fantasy role-playing, where even mighty warriors fear a knife in the back and powerful wizards get nervous around loaded crossbows. While Fantasy Earth is filled with action, role-playing is emphasized. The success of an adventure often depends more on careful planning than heroic battle, and your list of allies may matter more than your list of spells.

Fantasy Earth breaks the traditional rule that realism requires complexity by replacing pages of tables and charts with a simple target number resolution system. Non-combat skills are resolved on a simple d10, and many combats can be run without even opening the book!

Fantasy Earth features:
- A random, but fair, character generation system
- A skill-based system in which any character can learn any skill, just as in real life
- Detailed and ready-to-use skill descriptions for over 100 skills
- A realistic yet playable combat system: skill counts heavily, but all characters are vulnerable
- An experience system designed to compliment role-playing rather than interfere with it

This book does not contain the rules for magic. You must also have the Fantasy Earth Book of Magic to use the magic system.

56904.name: The Book of Magic
56904.description:
From the back of the book:

Lars held his sword high and watched the eight horsemen dancing their mounts back and forth around an invisible circle surrounding the blade. The men were visibly nervous, the horses more so. The one in chain mail, probably a knight, calmed his horse and spoke.
"Stop what you're doing, wizard, and surrender, and I give you my word you'll come to no harm." "And if I don't?"
"We'll see if an archer can defeat your spell."
Lars cursed softly and sheathed the sword. The soldiers breathed a small sigh of relief, their supernatural fear replaced by a natural one. He might still have other magicks.
"Throw the sword down," the knight ordered.
Shrugging, Lars unbuckled his baldric and tossed it to the ground.
"Get that," the knight said, pointing to one of his riders. "It is safe, wizard?" he added when the man balked.
Lars simply smiled as the soldier dismounted and slowly approached the enchanted weapon.
"Well?" the knight demanded.
"It's safe enough," Lars replied at last.
As the man reached for the weapon, he shot the mage a look of rage and fear....

Fantasy Earth offers a new way of viewing magic and mages. Mages have access to enormous power, but face great limitations as well. A mage has a different outlook on life, adventuring, and conflict than a normal man does. This difference adds an extra element of role-playing to being a mage in the world of Fantasy Earth.

Magic is designed to fit smoothly into the world, to be consistent with the sort of low fantasy role-playing for which Fantasy Earth is designed. The life of the average man is largely untouched by magic. However, beware the unknown wizard, for his power is unpredictable and his potential immense.

This book contains:
- Three different styles of magic, each giving a different feel to the characters who use them and the
world as a whole
- Over 100 pages of ready-to-use spells, plus rules for making up your own
- Complete information on creating magic items
- Rules for magical colleges and religious organizations and their benefits for members

56905.name: The Essential Fantasy Earth
56905.description:
From the back of the book:

What is Fantasy Earth?

Fantasy Earth is a fantasy role-playing game of gritty, realistic low fantasy, in which seasoned warriors fear a knife in the back and wizards get nervous around loaded crossbows. Dangerous? Yes, but skill, wit and courage can overcome even the greatest dangers. Read in, and enter the world of Fantasy Earth.

What's in The Essential Fantasy Earth?

The Essenrtial Fantasy Earth is a complete game system. You will need a few dice and your imagination, but all the information you need to play is in this book.

What If I Want More?

Although the Essential Fantasy Earth contains a condensed version of the Fantasy Earth rules system, it is designed to be compatible with the rest of the Fantasy Earth Game Master's Guide, plus all of our future releases. If you want more detailed rules or additional campaign source material, it's here for you.

What If I've Never Role-played Before?

The Essential Fantasy Earth is ideal for beginning role-players. Pre-generated sample characters, an easy to use rules system, and an introductory adventure let you start playing quickly, even if this is your first time as a player or game master. Plus, as your interes grows, Fantasy Earth can grow with you, with more gaming and adventure information when you're ready for it.

56906.name: WindZone
56906.description:
From the back of the book:

The world is flat, the sky is forever, and the Wind is. Everything. Every breath is a prayer and every exhale is a silent connection to all things. Welcome to WindZone.

It's time to learn a new mythology WindZone brings completely new ideas to the world or gaming. This book will introduce seven new races, each uniquely connected to the Wind. a literally endless world, new ideas about magic and technology, and completely different ways of thinking of life and death.

WindZone is flexible enough to allow players to choose any genre or time period Races include Felinoid (cat). Chiropteran (bat), Avian (bird), others that are land bound and still more that can fly using will power alone. These races inhabit mile high tree cities, sprawling megalopolises, cloud citadels, and floating islands in the sky

It's time to get blown away

56907.name: Interstellar Elite Combat
56907.description:
User summary:

The Interstellar Elite Combat rulebook covers the campaign setting, character creation, game mechanics, and combat rules. Also included is a introductory adventure.

56908.name: Arctic Combat
56908.description:
From the back of the book:

"ITS NOT A DOUBLE-EDGED SWORD, IT'S A MULTI-FACETED ROCKET!!"
- Zakcaria Simms, Master Gamer

Welcome to Dome #9, Arctic Combat! This domed, fridgid wasteland awaits you on the isle of Shalam-casal. Here under a massive energy shield is an equally giant, atmospherically controlled, glacially ter-raformed. volcanic rock where nearly any corporate conflict, including the War with the Empire, is fought for the sake of mass entertainment- From commanding a mechanized company, to slogging through the snow as an infantry trooper; from Conventional weapons, to the epitome of Ultratech exo-armor...battle calls you to enter The Games!

Shalam-casal thrives as a mega-popular casino island, where all forms of entertainment exist and battles are waged resolving victory or defeat for both the warrior and gambler.

As an adventurer you decide your alliance: Do you work for the Gaming Guild, better known as The Dark Company - those responsible for managing these games of capital entertainment? Are you a Gamer, a gladiator who flies his colors under the banner of The Brotherhood of Thars? Do you side in battle with the Renaidian Empire, as a member of their renowned Dark Knights? Are you in league with the overseeing Neutral Zone Military, a force with enough power to annihilate the entire planet? Or perhaps you are a Pacifist, and have searched your soul to find that against all odds you want to stop the commercial bloodshed, thus ending The Games. Whatever your reasons for being on Shalam-casal Island, or in Dome #9, there is plenty to keep you busy.

ARCTIC COMBAT comes complete with:
- A giant 21" x 33" Dome #9, Arctic Combat fold-out map
- 16 years of history describing the many factions in conflict on Shalam-casal
- An original Arctic Combat Storyboard
- 100 detailed encounter scenarios
- Updated ISE combat system information
- New Neutral Zone & Imperial Zone Conventional Weapons
- Vehiclular Combat Rules
- New Neutral Zone & Imperial Zone Conventional Vehicles

56909.name: Urban Fantasy Hero (HD Character Pack)
56909.description:
From the Hero Games website:

Character files from Urban Fantasy Hero for Hero Designer.

User Notes:

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

56910.name: Vibora Bay (HD Character Pack)
56910.description:
From the Hero Games website:

All the characters and powers from Vibora Bay in Hero Designer format.

User Notes:

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

rpg: So Ya Wanna Be A Rock'n'Roll Star
56911.name: So Ya Wanna Be a Rock 'n' Roll Star
56911.description:
From the back of the book:

NOW YOU CAN BE A ROCK 'N' ROLL STAR AND: Become the idol of millions of screaming fans! See your first single climb the charts to Number 1! Have the clothes torn from your body by rabid groupies! Shamelessly plug your new video as a guest host on MTV! Make a fool of yourself at the Grammy Awards! Be declared a bad influence on the youth of America! Watch your latest album go triple platinum! Watch all your royalties go to the dreaded Taxman! Get the funniest looks from everyone you meet!

DO ALL THIS - AND MORE! IN THIS WILD AND CRAZY ROCK 'N' ROLE-PLAYING GAME:

SO YA WANNA BE A ROCK 'N' ROLL STAR!

(Becoming a Superstar has never been so easy ... !)

56913.name: Villains, Vandals, and Vermin (HD Character Pack)
56913.description:
From the Hero Games website:

Character files from Villains, Vandals, and Vermin for Hero Designer.

User Notes:

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

56914.name: Beyond Reality
56914.description:
User summary:

The Beyond Reality rulebook contains the rules for character creation, game mechanics, combat and magic. Also included is a sample bestiary and a sample adventure.

Eight pages in the back of the book can be copied and folded to provide a GM reference booklet in A5 format.

56915.name: Villainy Amok (HD Character Pack)
56915.description:
From the Hero Games website:

All the villains, creatures and baddies from Villainy Amok in Hero Designer format.

User Notes:

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

56916.name: Net Worth
56916.description:
Net Worth is a financial game that attempts to teach budgeting principles by recreating a typical family economic situation. Players have a monthly budget that includes insurance, expenses, income, savings, and stock speculation.

Monthly income is determined by the job that each player receives at the beginning of the game and by investments that pay dividends or interest each month. Expenses are both fixed (for insurance, etc) and determined by random card draw. For example, a card may say, "You have a child go to college, pay $50 a month for the next 16 months." Players are also allowed to take loans, which of course increases monthly expenses.

The game ends after 24 months. The player with the highest Net Worth is the winner. Any player who's debts cannot be paid off is considered bankrupt and has lost.

There does not appear to be a maximum to how many people can play the game.

56917.name: VIPER: Coils of the Serpent (HD Character Pack)
56917.description:
From the Hero Games website:

All the characters, equipment and package deals from VIPER: Coils of the Serpent in Hero Designer format.

User Notes:

Hero Designer is a piece of software that greatly simplifies the creation of HERO System content by providing templates, error-checking, and a full set of powers, skills, etc., and more.

Hero fans (usually uncredited) volunteer to turn content from HERO System titles into Hero Designer format. No artwork is included in HD Character Packs.

56918.name: Victor Galitzin
56918.description:
User summary:

The Victor Galitzin rulebook contains all rules needed to create human characters. It includes the game mechanics and combat rules, but the magic rules are only rudimentary.

Apart from the cover artwork, Victor Galitzin contains no illustrations.

From the back of the book:

Dieses Fantasy-Rollenspiel verwendet die gleichen Regelmechanismen wie beim Perry Rhodan Rollenspiel. Allerdings stehen den Charakteren hier andere Fähigkeiten und Ausrüstungsgegenstände zur Verfügung. Reiten, das Entdecken und Entschärfen von Fallen und Geheimmechanismen gehört dazu, ebenso wie das obligatorische Schlösser öffnen und Spurenlesen. Auch bei diesem Rollenspiel gibt es die Möglichkeit, sich bei den Fähigkeiten zu spezialisieren.

Besonderes Gewicht wurde auf die Ausrüstung der Charaktere gelegt. Die 20 Körperstellen können einzeln gepanzert werden, wobei auch mehrere "Lagen" der gleichen oder unterschiedlicher Rüstungen miteinander kombiniert werden können.

Das Kampfsystem ist das eigentliche Herzstück dieses Rollenspiels. Bei jeder Waffe werden die Einsatzmöglichkeiten unterschieden — der ein- oder zweihändige Einsatz gehört dazu; Hieb, Stich, Stoß oder Parade. Entsprechend dem Waffentyp (stumpf, spitz oder scharf) sind die Auswirkungen auf die Panzerung unterschiedlich. Nicht jede Rüstung schützt gegen stumpfe Waffen! Wird der Körper getroffen, so können alle Beteiligten die Auswirkungen genau beobachten — leichte und schwere Treffer führen zunächst zu einem Blutverlust, später zu Handicaps, und abgetrennte oder zerschmetterte Gliedmaßen können die Folge dieser Kämpfe sein. Mit einem gutgesetzten Dolchstoß kann ein Charakter vom Leben zum Tod befördert werden! Victor Galitzin bietet realistische Kämpfe, ohne das dabei die Spielbarkeit in Frage gestellt wird.

56919.name: Spacefarers Guide to Alien Races
56919.description:
User Summary:
Half a page plus one illustration of humans and 100 alien races. Racial Parameters are given for each in a comparison table, with humans average 300 out of 1000 for each of the six statistics given - STR, DEX, CON, SPD, PSI, and EMP. Planet statistics for all races are given also. Conversion notes are given for Traveller, Space Patrol, and Space Quest.

From the Acknowledgments:
"Many of the races in this Spacefarer's Guide - fourty-five to be exact - were directly inspired by works of science fiction. I am happy to acknowledge these sources, which are listed below. All are excellent resources for the SFRP gamer."

56920.name: Aliens 'n' Blasters
rpgpublisher: Thor Aloc Fantasy- und Science-Fiction Club
56920.description:
User summary:

The Aliens 'n' Blasters rulebook contains the following:

- Character generation rules
- Combat rules
- Setting information
- A solitaire adventure
- Rules for robots and computers
- An optional grid-based movement system
- Vehicle rules

56924.name: Manhunter
56924.description:
From the back of the book:

In the High Tech World of Manhunter, Excitement is Just Around the Corner ... or the next Star!

- Complete rules for a Science Fiction/Fantasy, role playing campaign include everything from high tech to magick
- Choose from Terran, Robotic or Alien character types
- Unique new "Active Defense" combat system
- Special ship design and robotic design Rules
- Color Gamemaster's Screen

56926.name: EdLee: A Game of Self-Concept
56926.description:
EdLee - A Game of Self-Concept is a children's game designed to help players express positive attributes about themselves. The game is played on a Bingo like board with letters filled in on certain squares that say things like, "I am Loving," "I am Intelligent," or "I am Delightful." The group leader randomly chooses tiles with letter-number combinations that players then mark off on their card. When a player covers all the letters of their phrase, they must tell an example about how they are loving, delightful, etc. The group leader should encourage players to give very detailed examples and reinforce them with positive statements like, "I think you are loving because you are always kind to me." All of the players can win once their card is filled in and they have told their story.

The game supports up to 25 players (for a classroom setting).

56927.name: Cloudland
56927.description:
From the back cover:
"You have heard rumors that Cloudland is a huge castle built many decades ago by a powerful mage. The mage is long dead, but creatures still fight for control of the castle's awesome towers. Beneath the wall of Cloudland, in its subterranean expanses, are rumored to be untold riches and strong, arcane magicks. Many adventurers have attempted to probe its depths, none have ever returned. Do you have the skill and courage necessary to explore Cloudland?

A Fantasy Role-Playing Adventure Module For skill levels 1-4"

56929.name: Link: West
56929.description:
From the back cover:
"The spirit and adventure of the western frontier comes to life once more, in this exciting new roleplaying game designed for d20.

Lawmen, townsfolk, gentry and rustlers all work to survive in the brave new world. Free from the shackles of the Old World and its all-powerful Guilds and petty intrigues, the New World awaits.

But it might not be as easy to shake off the influence of the homeland as they might like.

Play any profession or creed you like, fight to protect your family or lands, and experience the joy of living in a land unsettled for thousands of years.

It can all be yours when you journey into Link:West."

56930.name: The ArkleTome
56930.description:
User summary:
A collection of RPG modifications used by the Arkwen role playing group. Each is said to be "well playtested".

Collection includes Magic Items, rules for Alchemy, Spells, Monsters, and the Vigilante Character Class. Also contains a history and pronunciation guide. A conversion chart of physical and mental attributes is provided also, e.g. P.P. = Physical Power = Strength.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Golden Geek Best 2-Player Board Game Nominee
56931.description:
The revolt in Rome will not end for a long time to come! Join the action and find out who is the most powerful ruler by skillfully playing your cards. No matter if you strengthen your own position with strong cards like Arena or Ballista or if you augment your victory points with Templarius and Triremis - you will be the winner if you use your characters and buildings with wit and savvy. You may also combine Roma II - Arena with Roma and discover even more options.

Arena is a complete game of its own, but it may very well be combined with the cards from Roma. These are the play options:

- Mix all the cards of both games and play with the combined set.
- Both players take one set of cards. Players will have their own draw and discard piles.
- Both players can use the cards of both games, compiling their own decks of 55 cards each. Again, both players will have their own draw and discard piles.

Integrates with:


Roma
56931.name: Arena: Roma II

56932.name: La Marca de los Profetas
56932.description:
¡Ay de aquel por quien vengan!

Desde el Mar Mediterráneo hasta el Río Éufrates se extienden mis dominios... Desde la ciudad de Sodoma gobierno mis posesiones tan justamente ganadas. En ellas, las órdenes de caballería infernal han situado sus sedes y conspiran contra mí, pues sospechan mi secreto.

En las montañas, humanos libres de los tres credos pretenden esconderse de mis ojos y buscan la manera de precipitar mi destrucción, mientras en las ciudades de mi feudo las sectas que adoran a mis rivales proliferan.

En el desierto Lilith recibe la visita de altos poderes que buscan mi desgracia, mientras mi alianza con los yinns es cada vez más frágil e inestable.

Y en el Cielo, Dios se burla de mí desde la Nube, tras la que esconde Sus huestes, preparadas para atacar mis tierras.

Pero yo soy el Marqués, y mío es el poder de este trozo de infierno en la Tierra. Así pues, entrad sin temor, pues nada deben temer mis invitados, sed bienvenidos a la Marca de los Profetas.

Translation by socnart and babeester:

Woe to whom they come for!

From the Mediterranean Sea to the Euphrates River my dominion extends... From the city of Sodom I rule my possessions so justly conquered. There, infernal knights’ orders have placed their headquarters and conspire against me, for they suspect my secret.

At mountains, free humans of the three creeds try to hide from my eyes and seek how to hasten my destruction while, in my feud’s cities, sects that worship my enemies are blooming.

In desert Lilith receives the visit of high powers which seek my doom, while my alliance with djinns is becoming fragile and unstable.

In Heaven, God is laughing at me from His Cloud, behind which he hides His hosts, ready to attack my lands.

But I´m the Marquis and mine is the power in this piece of Hell on Earth. So, come in without fear, because nothing should fear my guests, be welcomed to the Mark of the Prophet.

56933.description:
From the box:
After a long dark winter it's party time at the penguins. The sun is shining and, once again, there's fishing. To oversee the waters, the penguins build high pyramids. The more penguins fit in the pyramid, the better. But it's not that easy.

The players together build a pyramid, and who adds most cards wins.

This game looks very similar to Penguin, but not only differs in components (this is a card-game while Penguin had Penguin-playing pieces), but more importantly differs in number of colors and distribution.
Penguin has 4 colors with 9 pieces each, while this game has 5 different colors with a distribution of 4x7 + 1x8.
56933.name: Pinguin-Party

rpgitemversion: La Venganza de los Dragones del Arco Iris
56934.name: Revenge of the Rainbow Dragons
56934.description:
Endless Quest #6 (Sequel to Pillars of Pentegarn, Endless Quest #3)

From the back cover:
You have been tricked!

Forced into a duel of wizards at the mysterious Rainbow Castle, you are magically separated from your teacher and grandfather, Pentegarn, who battles for his life against three evil wizards. You must get back to him!

The paths you take are many and the choices are yous!

Will be be thrust into Limbo and be forced to explore the misty cloud castle and meet giant Rainbow Dragons?

Will you go into the dungeons and fight the strange monsters of the lower regions?

Or will you venture up into the highest towers of Rainbow Castle and be forced to overcome the magical traps that the evil wizards have set for you and our friends>

Action and adventure are yours in every ENDLESS QUEST book. You will find yourself returning again and again to experience new paths of excitement.

Remember! Only your choices can help bring about the REVENGE OF THE RAINBOW DRAGONS.

56935.name: Hero of Washington Square
rpgitemversion: O Herói de Washington Square (Portugal version)
56935.description:
Endless Quest #7

From back of book:
You are pursued by a gang of cutthroat spies who will stop at nothing to gain the secret of nuclear weaponry. The mysterious green diamonds you have been entrusted with seem to hold the missing key they are after.

What will you do?

The perils you face are many and the choices are yours!

Will you attempt to rescue Sam Brock, who has been kidnapped by the spiess to discover his secret source of uranium?

Or will you enlist the aid of your friends Pigeon Mary and Bagel Ben to thwart the gang's plans?

Action and adventure are yours in every ENDLESS QUEST book. You will find yourself returning again and again to experience new paths of excitement.

And if you succeed, you will have earned the title HERO OF WASHINGTON SQUARE.

56936.name: Robbers and Robots
56936.description:
An Endless Quest #9

Product Description:
The reader, as Terry Morton, becomes involved in an attempt to steal the plans for a top secret security robot from his uncle's electronics factory. --This text refers to an out of print or unavailable edition of this title.

56937.name: The Unspeakable Oath (Issue 14/15 - 1997)
rpgissuearticle: From Beyond - Facing Racism in Lovecraft and Call of Cthulhu
HP Lovecraft Film Festival - Field Report
Mysterious Manuscripts - The Lord of the Yellow Sign
Mysterious Manuscripts -Charles Fort's X and Y
A Tale of Terror - Dead... and Buried?
A Tale of Terror - Oily Grave
A Tale of Terror - The Willowdales
The Eye of Light and Darkness
The Knights Templar - A Secret Society
What You Should Know About the Tommy Gun
56937.description:
subtitled For Call of Cthulhu.

Double issue, no reason for this is given in the editorial.

Cover by John T. Snyder

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

56938.name: Points of Light
56938.description:
Publisher Blurb:

Four Realms, Four Evils.

War horns wail and perilous realms cry out for heroes! Four settings, each detailed and mapped, ideal for novices launching their first campaign, or veteran GMs looking to challenge their players with terrible foes and foreign lands...

* Wildland:The fall of the Bright Empire left warring factions in its wake. As savage barbarians and wicked humanoids roam the land, the last bastions of civilization cower behind their crumbling city walls. A dark age has come, and none may live to tell the tale.
* Southland: On the frontiers of the Great Kingdom, the nations of men, elves and dwarves join together against the wicked elves of Nighportal Keep and the Orcs of the Bloody Fist. A realm is yours for the taking, if you can carve it from the wilderness.
* Borderland: Two factions clash over war-torn fields, battling for dominance in a civil war that that has torn a once-mighty empire in two. When brother strives against brother, and blood runs in the streets, who will emerge to unify the broken land—and at what cost, peace?
* The Swamps of Acheron: In the Outer Planes, amid fetid swamplands and ice-choked mountains, the fell god Sarrath holds court. In a realm where gods stalk the earth, will you dare to take a stand, or will you succumb to evil's siren song and take up the Serpent Banner?

The tide of evil must be turned back, and heroes are few. Do your characters have the courage to rise against the coming darkness?

56939.name: Sahasra: The Land of 1,000 cities
56939.description:
Publisher Blurb:

A setting for d20 fantasy, inspired by the myths and legends of India.

Long ago in Sahasra, the fabled Land of 1,000 Cities, when a woman's delicate beauty could smite a man's heart on first sight of her, and a man's bravery was judged by the strength of his arm and the devotion of his soul...a party of adventurers set out on a journey that would change their lives.

Immerse yourself in Sahasra, the newest Folkloric setting for d20 fantasy by author Donna K. Fitch. Countless wonders await the brave traveler: the legendary city of Ujjayini, that bustles and thrives alongside the river Shipra; the Monkey City of Kishkindha, hidden in the lush, vine-tangled grotto of Pampa lake; the underground city of Dirindhala, home of the mysterious and proud Rock Nagas; the ruined city of Sisupal, carefully guarded by the Yakshini - fey creatures that revere nature and abhor intruders...

Use the city generation tables to populate your own Sahasran adventure, or walk the pathways expertly built by author Donna K. Fitch. A generous amount of npc's, monsters, and fabulous treasure await your party in this exotic, highly-detailed setting.

56940.name: Shrine of the Fallen Lama
56940.description:
Publisher Blurb:

An Adventure for Character Levels 10-12

The Shrine of Zongxian was once a force for good, ruled by an immortal being through a thousand incarnations. But arrogance and hubris laid the shrine low, and now evil sits atop the high mountain throne. Can your heroes stand against a force that has reigned since time immemorial? Or will they fall like those before them, their bodies cast from the high mountain walls, to break like dolls on the rocky plateau below? One thing is certain: only the most fearless and resourceful of heroes can hope to return from the Shrine of the Fallen Lama.

56941.name: Monster Mash
56941.description:
Each player (“Coach”) commands a team of three monsters in a gladiator style fight for victory over their peers. As the game progresses the monster’s movement and combat attributes can be enhanced. This improvement happens once per round and by monsters defeating their opponents.
When a team is ready they can try to defeat the all powerful End Level Champion.

56942.description:
Toward the end of this century, Mankind will push north to the melting ice and the last of the recoverable crude. Each round, opponents take turns co-ordinating multiple units of varying ability (orders are placed and carried out), with the purpose of controlling as much battlefield as possible before the Arctic Oil Reserve runs dry.

There’s eight rounds-of-play and various ways to maximise Victory Points. Game duration falls between thirty and fifty minutes, depending on experience, with rules of around 1100 words. This is a 2-Player mini-version of a well-tested 4-Player game.
56942.name: Arctic Meltdown: 2 Player Mini Version

56943.description:
Silk Road

The legendary Silk Road! An extensive system of connections. Trading flourished mightily during this period; it was such a lucrative business that merchants and traders tried to bring the most exotic goods to the west; goods such as spices, porcelain and silk were so precious in the west, that they were weighed against jewels!

Together, the players move 3 caravans through the infamous trails of the Silk Road, expanding their inventory and selling at the most profitable margin in the markets. On the long road dust storms threaten, footpads lurk or fat tax collectors want to cash in! Once the caravan reaches its destination, only the best traders are rewarded with jewels. Who will have the most precious gem collection at the end of this exciting game?

Game material: 1 game board, 80 cards, 30 gems, 1 cloth bag, 5 screens, 22 action tokens, 8 victory point marker
10 wooden discs, 10 stickers, 1 rulebook, 1 Summary Sheet
56943.name: Seidenstraße

56944.description:
POWERBOATS EXPANSION 1 you can add complete to the Powerboats game.
These tiles can bring your speedboat in trouble, but you try take advantage of the new situation.
CONTENT:
7 tiles, each 3 water hexes long. 2 sides, dark and light blue (like the game board sides):
2x Redoubt
2x Current
2x Maelstrom
1x Low-water
56944.name: Powerboats Expansion 1

56945.name: PhoenixCrawl
56945.description:
In Xcrawl, the players are superstar athletes taking their chances in a live-on-pay-per-view death sport. It’s a modern-day world with a fantasy twist, and the game is simple. The Dungeon Judge, or DJ, creates an artificial dungeon under controlled – but lethal – conditions. The players go through the dungeon and try to fulfill whatever conditions the DJ puts forth in order to win. Xcrawl is a sport and the challenges are created, but the danger is no less real. If you die, you die!

The official Xcrawl tournament module of Gen Con 2007, the PhoenixCrawl Open is set in a state-of-the-art new arena out of Phoenix, Arizona. This high-octane dungeon promises to be anything but normal as the fire-themed adventure proves there’s more at stake than just prizes when its DJ turns out to be more than human!

This is a stand-alone adventure that can be played with only the core d20 books! Pregenerated characters are included.

(from the Publisher's Site)

56946.name: Gipsy King Expansion 1
56946.description:
GIPSY KING EXPANSION 1 you can add complete to the Gipsy King game.

Each player gets a bridge tile, to connect 2 of your groups of caravans which are seperated by water. For connecting your caravans by the bridge you place your bridge between your newest caravan and a caravan at the other side of a water hex.

56947.name: Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy's Question and Answer Game
56947.description:
An old Trivia game based on the children televisionseries Edgar Bergen and Charlie McCarthy.
The cards are printed on both sides. One Question side and one answer side.

56948.name: Dragon of Doom
56948.description:
Endless Quest 13

Product description:
The evil magic-user Zed has used a powerful, forbidden spell to summon forth the mighty Shen, the dreaded black Dragon of Doom! Unless you can do something to stop him, Zed will turn Shen loose on the world to spread death and destruction wherever he goes. The perils you face are many, and the choices are yours! Will you follow Zed to the desolate End of the World and try to prevent his sinister rendezvous with the Dragon of Doom? Or will you instead proceed to the fabled Dragon Castle in an attempt to foil Zed's evil plan?

In every ENDLESS QUEST book, action and adventure are yours. You will find yourself returning again and again to experience new paths of excitement. And if your efforts are successful, you will have saved the entire world from the DRAGON OF DOOM.

56949.description:
FACTORY FUN EXPANSION 1 you can add complete to the Factory Fun game.

Edit: These tiles are included in the new Factory Fun release by Z-Man Games.

Each player gets 1 expansion "tile", which is a 2 space by 1 space criss-crossed pipe.
Use it if you can and want. It's cool if it works well in your factory.
56949.name: Factory Fun Expansion 1

56950.name: The Mongoose Pocket Player's Handbook
56950.description:
From the back cover:
"The Mongoose Pocket Player's Handbook is a simple guide to the world's most popular roleplaying game system. It contains exactly what a reader needs to play the game and nothing else.

With this guide to the intricacies of the OGL rules set, Players and Games Masters can make use of any other setting material or devise their own for a campaign that is uniquely theirs while still retaining the basic framework of the OGL game. If it is a basic rule covering character creation, combat, equipment or magic, it has a home in these pages.

Everything you need, in a pocket-sized edition with a pocket-sized price."

56951.description: Place the cards face down on the table. On the cards there are pictures of different items, like a hat, a rollerskate, glasses and a teddy bear. Every player tries to collect all the different items. On the players turn he/she looks at the card. When the player doesn't has the item he/she gets a point. Otherwise the card is placed back on the table.
56951.name: Kleiner Rabe findet alles

56953.name: The Mongoose Pocket Games Master's Guide
56953.description:
From the back cover:
"The Mongoose Pocket Games Master's Guide is a simple reference book to the world's most popular roleplaying game system. It contains exactly what a reader needs to play the game and nothing else.

With this guide to the intricacies of the OGL rules set, Players and Games Masters can make use of any other setting material or devise their own for a campaign that is uniquely theirs while still retaining the basic framework of the OGL game. If it has anything to do with running roleplaying games, it has a home in these pages.

Everything you need, in a pocket-sized edition with a pocket-sized price!"

56954.description:
Princes of the Sun contains 120 cards for use with A Game of Thrones: The Card Game and is an essential foundation for anyone looking to play House Martell in the LCG environment. Infamous Martell characters like Prince Doran and Princess Arianne Martell, Areo Hotah, Ser Arys Oakheart, Darkstar, the Daynes of Sunspear, and the Red Viper himself are featured, along with the staple building block cards necessary to make the Martells a competitive option.

Description for 2011 revised edition from the publisher:

The Princes of the Sun reprint for A Game of Thrones: The Card Game, marked with "Revised Edition" on the front of the box, now includes three copies of each of the 60 unique cards included in the original printing. Featuring the defiant and treacherous vengeance-seekers of the Dornish sands, Princes of the Sun offers players a full play set with which to immediately begin competitive House Martell deck-building. Also included is an intriguing "Civil War" game variant that lets players compete for the limited resources of a single deck.

House Martell excels at icon manipulation, the production of influence, and in vengeance: to do well against this House is asking for punishment. Princes of the Sun showcases House Martell's counterintuitive win strategy, "winning through losing". That is, this strategy comprises of letting your opponents win certain challenges in order for you to win others or take some other benefit. Get ready to have a bloodthirsty response to House Martell's slights with Princes of the Sun!
56954.name: A Game of Thrones: The Card Game – Princes of the Sun
boardgamefamily: A Song of Ice and Fire

56955.name: Workout
56955.description:
Board game for 2 to 6 players, in which pieces are moved on the board after rolling two die.

There are cards for going to the doctor, do an excercise, do a sporting activity. There are trophies that are won when the player's piece sits on a sporting activity box and rolling the two die results with at least one of the dice being a "1".

Doctor's card may slow you down by forcing a procedure or exam that might make you lose your next turn.

Slogan: "You just don't sit down and play. Have fun and excercise at the same time"

Cadaco game, No. 770

56958.name: The Unspeakable Oath (Issue 16/17 - 2001)
rpgissuearticle: Arcane Artifacts - Jack the Ripper's Knives
Arcane Artifacts - The Strange Spectacles of Dr. Scolius
Lesser Evils - Lesser Known, Less-Powerful Tomes for Call of Cthulhu
A Tale of Terror - Every Mother's Nightmare
A Tale of Terror - Raven at Birmingham's
A Tale of Terror - Shallow Roadside Grave
Technology and Science of the Twenties and Thirties
The Eye of Light and Darkness
56958.description:
subtitled For Call of Cthulhu.

Double issue, and this issue has no editorial.

Cover by John Coulthart

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

56961.name: Conan the Undaunted
56961.description:
Endless Quest #19

From the back of the book:
You are only a young man, but your strength and fighting abilities are already held in awe by your tribe - the Cimmerians. While on a hunting trip, you and your friend, Keelta, come across an Aquilonian knight fighting for his life against Marsh Riders. You arrive too late to help the wounded knight. He dies in Keelta's arms - but not before he has laid a death quest on you!

Now you must deliver the dead knight's map to Aquilonia. The March Riders and their vicious war wolves know you have the map and have vowed your death! You might be able to escape them by going through the evil Black City of Wizards - but do you have the courage to face the dreadful magic creatures rumored to haunt the city?

You are Conan. The prophecy is yours - and so are the choices in an ENDLESS QUEST Book.

56962.description:
Morrigan is a card game in which the players compete to gather as much prestige as possible in the eyes of the King of Beltaine.

Each of them will seek out the most harrowing of trials and bring back the most incredible trophies to gain the right to confront the terrible Maletar and to free the Princess Morrigan from his grasp.
56962.name: Morrigan

56963.name: The Endless Catacombs
56963.description:
Endless Quest #22

From back of book:
You are only too well aware of the wizard's curse placed on the dreaded Endless Catacombs. Now the curse is beginning to spread its evil throughout the land. Do you dare accompany the strange band of adventurers into the catacombs to attempt to remove the curse?

You are about to enter the exciting world experienced by the players of the popular DUNGEONS AND DRAGONS Game. It is a fantasy world filled with enchanted castles and fearsome monsters. Are YOU brave enough to meet its challenges?

In other ENDLESS QUEST Books, you can combat secret agents skilled in espionage, journey to the corners of the galaxy, or attempt to survive in a future world ravaged by wars.

Each ENDLESS QUEST Book is based on an exciting role-playing game, but you don't need to know the game to enjoy the book. Just make your choices, and accept the consequences!

Remember! Only your choices lead to success in ENDLESS QUEST Books.

56964.name: The Fires of War: The Algernon Files Volume 2
56964.description:
"From the BlackWyrm games website:"

The fires of war burn on the horizon, and a world already short on hope desperately looks for heroes. Luckily, they don't have far to look. Welcome to the so-called Golden Age, where the first generation of superhumans in the public eye are forging legends that will live on long after they're gone. Nazi supersoldiers terrorize Europe, while gangsters vie against mad scientists for control of the underworld. Masked mystery men and two-fisted adventurers bring justice into the darkest alleys and deepest jungles.

The Fires of War is a sourcebook for the early days of the world of capes and cowls. It includes over a hundred write-ups of characters on both sides of the fence, good guys and bad, as well as a dozen exotic locales, maps, and details on wartime equipment and vehicles....


over 100 characters
heroes and villains
vehicles and maps

56965.name: The Wurst of Grimtooth's Traps
56965.description:
From the back of the book:

More horrible than a nightmare, more feared and loathed than the IRS, Grimtooth the Troll has returned with the best of his traps to try men's souls and mangle their bodies! This connoisseur's catalog of condemnable calamities contains over 200 of the most devious devices ever devised, all redesigned for use with the d20 system. Includes the famous Grimtooth's Traps Bazaar and Grimtooth's Dungeon of Doom, a dungeon of nothing but traps!

56967.name: Mecha & Manga
56967.description:
From publisher blurb:

Super Mecha Roleplay is Go!

Japanese manga and anime have become hugely popular in the English-speaking world and now they are here for the Mutants & Masterminds roleplaying game! Mecha & Manga takes M&M from its Silver Age roots into a whole new style of comics, the realm of manga. Inside you'll find:

Characters! All the information you need to create characters for a variety of manga and anime genres, including more than twenty ready-to-play archetypes from the Magical Girl to the Mecha Pilot.
Powers! All-new M&M powers, including Battle Form, Martial Arts Stance, and information on Power Combos, along with new modifiers to recreate your favorite abilities from the source material.
Mecha! Detailed rules for creating and running powerful mecha, from mobile suits to giant war-machines, including components, combat rules, and ready-to-run examples.
Adventures! Eight exciting series frameworks, including the complete Shards: Unsung Destiny series, which allows you to incorporate all of the material in this book into a single epic mega-setting!




If you're a fan of manga, or just curious what it's all about, Mecha & Manga is the sourcebook for you!

56968.name: Judges Guild Journal (Issue 18 - Dec 1979/Jan 1980)
56968.description:
From the table of contents:

FEATURES:

Venifics by Thomas McCloud
Special Feature: Awesomely Voluminous 28 Page AD&D Graduate Thesis: Random Monster Tables by Mike Mayeau
This Month's Featured Mini-Dungeon: The Dreaded Devil Den by Jeff Martin
Operation Ogre Tournament Results and Comments by Mike Mayeau




COLUMNS

Tips From the Tower by Bryan Hinnen
Jocular Judgements by Chuck Anshell
Judges Guild Classified Ads
Convention Watch

56970.name: Circus of Fear
56970.description:
Endless Quest #10

From back cover:
You know too much!

You learn that a cruel circus owner plans to take over the country. Somehow you must get away and expose his scheme. What will YOU do?

The dangers you face are many and the choices are yours!

Will you tell the animal trainer, even though he can turn his menagerie of ferocious beasts loose on you? Will you tell your story to the boastful trapeze artist who holds your life in his hands high above the center ring? Or will you seek help from the sideshow "freaks" who want to turn you into a living mummy? Action and adventure are yours in every ENDLESS QUEST book. You will find yourself returning again and again to experience new paths of excitement.

Remember! Only your choices can save the kingdom from the CIRCUS OF FEAR.

56971.name: Dungeons & Dragons Official Roleplaying Soundtrack
rpghonor: 2006 ENnie for Best Aid or Accessory - Silver Winner
56971.description:
Product description:
Midnight Syndicate brings you the first-ever officially licensed soundtrack to the roleplaying classic that started it all.

Ancient underground temples, dark knights, mysterious labyrinths, sorcerers, forgotten tombs, enchanted forests, and creatures await you on this new release containing over an hour of orchestral music from the masters of gothic/horror soundscape. It's the ultimate musical accompaniment to the DUNGEONS & DRAGONS roleplaying game, and promises to take listeners on an epic adventure through the darkest corners of their imagination.

Working closely with the game designers at Wizards of the Coast, this CD is a simple yet dynamic way for gamers to take their adventuring sessions to the next level.

56972.name: Under Dragon's Wing
56972.description:
Endless Quest 15

Product Description:
The legions of the evil Crimson Wizard are besieginh the walled city that is your home. With the help of your magical dragon ring and ancient sorcery book. It is up to you to stop them But will these aids be enough? You are about to enter the exciting world experienced by the players of the popular DUNGEONS AND DRAGONS Game. It is a fantasy world filled with enchanted castles and fearsome moneters. Are YOU brave enough to meet its challenges? In other ENDLESS QUEST Books, you combat secret agents skilled in espionage, journey to the corners of the galasy, or attempt to survive in a future world ravaged by wars.

Each ENDLESS QUEST Book is based on an exciting role-playing game, but you don't need to know the game to enjoy the book. Just make your choices, and accept the consequences! Remember! Only your choices lead to success in ENDLESS QUEST Books.

56973.name: The Dragon's Ransom
56973.description:
Endless Quest #16

Product description:
You are honored by being chosen treasure seeker to raise the ransom that must be paid to the Golden Dragon who stands guard over the Land of Oon. But first you must face danger from fierce orcs, trolls, hobgoblins, and... what else? You are about to enter the exciting world experienced by the players of the popular DUNGEONS AND DRAGONS Game. It is a fantasy world filled with enchanted castles and fearsome moneters. Are YOU brave enough to meet its challenges? In other ENDLESS QUEST Books, you combat secret agents skilled in espionage, journey to the corners of the galasy, or attempt to survive in a future world ravaged by wars.

Each ENDLESS QUEST Book is based on an exciting role-playing game, but you don't need to know the game to enjoy the book. Just make your choices, and accept the consequences! Remember! Only your choices lead to success in ENDLESS QUEST Books.

56974.name: King's Quest
56974.description:
Endless Quest #18

Publisher blurb:
The map given to you by the dying stranger may lead to treasure, but not before you encounter many dreaded creatures. But you gave your word to fulfill your quest...

You are about to enter the exciting world experienced by the players of the popular DUNGEONS AND DRAGONS Game. It is a fantasy world filled with enchanted castles and fearsome monsters. Are YOU brave enough to meet its challenges?

In other ENDLESS QUEST Books, you can combat secret agents skilled in espionage, journey to the corners of the galaxy, or attempt to survive in a future world ravaged by wars.

Each ENDLESS QUEST Book is based on an exciting role-playing game, but you don't need to know the game to enjoy the book. Just make your choices, and accept the consequences!

Remember! Only your choices lead to success in ENDLESS QUEST Books.

56975.name: Conan and the Prophecy
56975.description:
Endless Quest #20

From back of book:
Out of the cold, far-off lands of Cimmeria comes a young man known to his tribe as a strong and mighty warrior - Conan! You are Conan. A refugee from your homeland, you've risked life and limb to escape the slavery of the Hyperboreans and head for the famed land of Zamora. Now you and your friend, Mombe, seek your fortunes among the dark alleys of the Maul - the area of Arenjun seething with cut-throat criminals, cold-blooded mercenaries, and worse.

Having rescued a blind beggar from a beating, you discover the old man is a sage and are rewarded with a strange prophecy that predicts adventure and danger in store for you tonight! But where will the prophecy lead you - to a slaver's keep? One of the forbidden temples? The tower of a powerful sorcerer? And will you have the courage to face whatever befalls you in this city of thieves?

You are Conan. The prophecy is yours - and so are the choices in an ENDLESS QUEST Book.

rpgitemversion: Los Guerreros del Templo de la Luna
56976.name: Duel of the Masters
56976.description:
Endless Quest #21

From back of book:
You have been chosen to help the mysterious stranger whose city has been taken over by tha evil Kashkar, a master of the martial arts. Armed only with your staff and your skill, can ou - a master of the martial arts yourself - hope to defeat the powerful Kashkar?

You are about to enter the exciting world experienced by the players of the popular DUNGEONS AND DRAGONS Game. It is a fantasy world filled with enchanted castles and fearsome monsters. Are YOU brave enough to meet its challenges?

In other ENDLESS QUEST Books, you can combat secret agents skilled in espionage, journey to the corners of the galaxy, or attempt to survive in a future world ravaged by wars.

Each ENDLESS QUEST Book is based on an exciting role-playing game, but you don't need to know the game to enjoy the book. Just make your choices, and accept the consequences!

Remember! Only your choices lead to success in ENDLESS QUEST Books.

56977.name: Kobold Quarterly (Issue 2 - Fall 2007)
rpgissuearticle: Belphegor, the Baron of Laziness and Invention
Empire of the Ghouls: the Avatar of Hunger
From the Outside In, Creating Vibrant Characters
King of All Monsters: Wanye Reynolds
On the Streets Where Heroes Live
